name: Luminous Silk Perfect Glow Flawless Oil-Free Foundation
about: What it is:¬†An award-winning, oil-free liquid foundation that delivers buildable medium coverage and a luminous, glowy-skin finish for a natural makeup look...30ml Full Size for everyday use.18ml Travel Size for on-the-go..Coverage:¬†Medium..Finish:¬†Natural..Formulation:¬†Liquid..What Else You Need to Know: This lightweight foundation with Micro‚Äìfil‚Ñ¢ technology allows color pigments to lay flat for seamless blending and layering. A makeup artist and celebrity favorite, this hydrating foundation helps improve skin texture and blur imperfections, all while delivering a long-lasting, lit-from-within glow
ingredients: -Micro-Fil Technology: Provides a translucent radiance and flawless finish...Aqua / Water, Cyclopentasiloxane, Glycerin, Isododecane, Alcohol Denat., Polyglyceryl-4 Isostearate, Cetyl Peg/Ppg-10/1 Dimethicone, Hexyl Laurate, Aluminum Starch Octenylsuccinate, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Phenoxyethanol, Acetylated Glycol Stearate, Magnesium Sulfate, Peg-10 Dimethicone, Trihydroxystearin, Cellulose Gum, Nylon-12, Limonene, Benzyl Salicylate, Benzyl Alcohol, Linalool, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-Di-T-Butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate, Isobutane, Diphenyl Dimethicone, Acrylonitrile/Methyl Methacrylate/Vinylidene Chloridecopolymer, Parfum / Fragrance, Disodium Stearoyl Glutamate, Methylparaben, Butylphenyl Methylpropional, Aluminum Hydroxide, Hexyl Cinnamal.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-For a glowing, airbrushed foundation finish, apply the foundation to the center of the face and blend outward using a foundation brush..-Apply using a damp sponge for a more dewy, luminous makeup look..-Add more layers for seamless coverage with a natural, flawless skin finish..-Use Luminous Silk Glow Setting Powder (sold separately) over the foundation for a longer-lasting makeup result..Makeup looks:.‚Ä¢ Luminous Silk Foundation can be used for your everyday no-makeup makeup look.‚Ä¢ Use to achieve a soft glam makeup look; perfect for wedding makeup, or wedding guest makeup.‚Ä¢ Use to achieve a glass skin makeup look with a glowy finish

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm 37, with reactive, sensitive skin that is relatively dry due to where I live (Colorado). Most of my 30s have been punctuated by me trying new foundations for my changing skin, and failing miserably. This one, however, is the closest I have found to an amazing option -- it's not perfect, because it doesn't last as long as I'd like it to, and I have to be careful about how much I use because my skin has a much smaller margin of error now that I'm a little older (boo).  That said, I know if I put this on, it will look good. The shade range is great, I love that it doesn't have a smell, and it doesn't make my skin have a reaction. I still have yet to find the best way too apply it so it looks smooth, but that's a me problem. Yes, it is expensive, but if you have sensitive skin that is easily irritated or turns red/is otherwise reactive, I recommend this one. I also appreciate that they make the small mini sizes as it makes the product more accessible.   Generally speaking, this is the best option I've found in YEARS, but it's not QUITE 5-stars. If it lasted longer and looked a little smoother, then we'd be there. But, I do recommend it and have been very happy with it on my extremely finicky skin.

reviews.review_title: No One Can Do Neutral/Cool, Rosey Shades
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is not the first time I've tried this product but I just can't get past the shade. And let's face it, this could be the ultimate foundation on the planet but if the shade is off, I can't be objective. There are very few cosmetic lines that can do neutral and/or cool. This basically looks like a very yellowish shade. I think I could be persuaded to keep this foundation if the color matched the description. It does make my skin feel a little taut. But essentially, no one can top Estee Lauder's Double Wear when it comes to a matte foundation. Estee also delivers cool tones like Fresco or Pebble As much as I want to try and have tried the latest and best products today, I tend to revert back to Estee for foundation because I simply cannot get the right shade and I really do hate yellow. Period.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Best foundation that has ever been on my face!! I suppose it's true about some things: if it costs more, it's better quality. I learned of this foundation via a couple of foil packet samples. As soon as I applied the sample stuff I was like, What is this wizardry on my fingers and face? My skin turns almost 100% flawless for the first time in a long time! I was just messing around and 'playing' with some of my items had just received in a Sephora order that day. So, I hadn't really prepped my skin well or anything, so I thought to myself imagine if I had cleansed, exfoliated, and probably moisturized prior to application of the foundation??? So, I quickly got online and ordered a full-size and travel-size bottle for myself. Yes, it's expensive compared to the loads of other foundations out there, including other luxury lower priced options, but THIS is THE STUFF!!! I also then went to the Armani Beauty website and got another backup bottle during their sale for 25% off. That's how much i love this stuff and now I'm going to tell you why: ‚Ä¢ silky, liquid texture can be applied with fingers, sponge or brush with excellent results  ‚Ä¢ medium buildable coverage ‚Ä¢ leaves a natural, realistic skin-like finish ‚Ä¢ blends super easily  ‚Ä¢ a little bit of product goes a long way ‚Ä¢ large shade range  I hope this review helps someone in some way. I very highly recommend this foundation for all skin types. I also recommend getting a travel size bottle if you're not sure quite yet. Good luck!!

reviews.review_text: New fave. My first time using this tried and true foundation, I‚Äôm in my mid thirties. I have textured skin (a few wrinkles, some small bumps), it‚Äôs a bit on the combo side mostly dry‚Ä¶ I LOVE this. First off it‚Äôs a watery formula that sets pretty quickly the finish is more on the matte side but not drying to the skin. I usually don‚Äôt wear any primers, I prep my skin with 2-3 products and this did well with that. After hours it looks so pretty and soft. I thought it would accentuate my flaws but it didn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs buildable. I bought this online and have to say finding a color match was a bit confusing. The shades seem a little out of order, and some of the product photos labeled my shade a different shade. I‚Äôm a true neutral tone and light-light medium, I got the 4.5 but I could have gone with the 5 which is light neutral especially now that summers over, the cold sucks any color from my face. When it‚Äôs wet it‚Äôs a bit lighter than when it sets. So keep that in mind.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Gray eyes, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Worth every cent. It's not a full coverage foundation. I put it on with a foundation brush, blends right in. I don't even have to look in the mirror that's how smooth it goes in. I never have an issue with oxidation and I have combo, mature skin 49 years of leveling up. Doesn't settle in my lines, stays beautiful and natural looking until I wash it off at the end of the day. reviews.review_text: This foundation is for people that want that no makeup makeup look. If you are looking for something high coverage and matte - this isnt for you. I usually stare into my skin to see how my foundation and concealers settle and am veru judgy about makeup products lol this one is THE ONLY foundations that does not look like foundati0on on my skin (dior backstage is a close second)   I live in NYC, I take the subway to work and I sweat ALOT in the summer. esp on my face ( i carry a handheld fan in my purse, its THAT bad) This foundation holds up very well all day including my gross commute, sweaty face, and a regular work day, and sometimes after work dinner/drinks. I wear this with the milk hydrogrip primer, armani concealer, armani luminous setting powder, and charlotte tilbury seetting spray and it pretty much lasts me all day.   I will say though about 6-7 hours in, I can start to FEEL the makeup on my face. Up until that point it doesnt feel like I have make up on, but around 3-4pm on a workday, I want to just wipe my face off.  Overall its a good product, I love how it looks on me. Knocking off a star for the price + the feeling of makeup on my face towards the end of the day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, gray hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been using LS in shade #2 for a number of years now. I measure every foundation sample I've tried against it, and they all come up short.   *I do have one nitpicky complaint regarding the description of my shade, #2. When shade #1.5 was added to range a few years ago, Armani Beauty changed the description of shade #2 from fair, neutral, to fair, peach. Shade #1.5 is described as fair, neutral, however, it is deeper and far peachier than #2 (which BTW, per Armani Beauty, did NOT change in color). While shade #2 could be a touch lighter for me, it is by far the best match in a formula I love, and is truly a fair shade, with neutral undertones. FWIW, I have tried samples of the uber-pricey La Mer, and more reasonably priced Pat McGrath foundations. Their formulas are lovely, however, their lightest shades have pink undertones (pretty common), so they're a no-go for me.  incorrect descriptor aside, Luminous Silk is a wonderful foundation! I often get compliments, and I'm asked, what if any foundation I'm wearing (e.g. your skin looks so good, are you wearing foundation?). It plays nicely with my Tatcha skincare and sunscreen (Silken Sunscreen the original one in the tube), as well as with both silk primers and it holds up well on my combination-oily skin. I prefer a light coverage, so I apply it with a damp Beauty Blender, and will often buff it out after application with a brush. I add a few dots of concealer where extra coverage might be needed. LS is totally buildable for those who prefer fuller overall coverage, but I like to keep it on the lighter side  As for cost, it's not cheap, but it's worth it. And, if you can catch a Sephora or other retailer sale event/promotion, or buy directly from Armani Beauty during their sale events (often 30% or 40% off with code!), you can often get it for much less $.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: Who Needs a Foundation This Expensive? YOU DO.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brunette hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I won't lie, I avoided this based on price for years. I also won't lie and say I'm some spring chicken with perfect skin. Nope, I'm the demographic who is stuck in both the aging (lines, wrinkles, dullness) and hormonal (menopause, acne) AND the dryness and sensitivity that comes with skin care interventions targeted at our range.  I can no longer pull off 24-hour wear or matte foundations (unless the Crypt Keeper becomes a trend). Heavy perfumed makeup is an instant hard no. I have tried pretty much every sub-$65 foundation in all finishes, both high end and drugstore. And promptly returned them, given it away, or chucked it. I agree it's wasteful. It's also hard on your self-esteem.  I received a sample of an even more expensive foundation, and it wasn't quite right, but it was *almost* right. Which led me to thinking maybe this one *could* have a following for a reason other than its brand name. So, I broke down and tried it, and had fully expected to be disappointed.  I WAS SO WRONG.  This is, hands down, one of the most beautiful foundations ever made. It's not juicy dewy fake or heavy; you just look healthy and polished. The coverage is just enough, but it doesn't cover everything and I still need to camo any hormonal breakouts. The trade off is the rest of my skin looks fabulous.  For the most part, it doesn't settle into my lines and wrinkles. But, full disclosure, it will sometimes crease in my horizontal forehead line, yet it is super easy to tap/buff out. Ladies, look. At some point we're going to have to acknowledge that unless we have full-blown plastic surgery + Botox (which is fine if that's your choice), there is no magic solution. There is the best at what it does with tolerable trade offs. THIS IS THAT THING. Colour match is perfect.  It took a bit to find the right sunscreen/primer combo, but after that, smooth sailing. Try it and give it a fair go. It's truly stunning, and will last a good while, so it's got some added value for money!

reviews.review_text: So far this is my favorite foundation. It leaves a very natural finish to the skin. Definitely more for girls who want light minimal coverage. I think you can definitely build it out warm but I wouldn‚Äôt want to because it just looks so good with using a little product

reviews.review_text: This has been the only foundation I used since my first purchase in 2018. My face is usually acne-free, and the light-medium coverage works perfectly for me; one pump is enough to blur my pores, redness, and mild scarring, evening my skin tone and melting into a natural finish. I use argan oil on my face before applying, which works well for me. I have also tried the Tatcha moisturizer as a base and thought it looked great. This foundation has gotten me several compliments from strangers and friends. It helps make my skin look soft and hydrated, and people would ask if I am actually wearing foundation! My face can start looking oily after a few hours of wear, but powder or blotting sheets make an easy fix. Totally worth it.

I found my shade and it was perfect match, however, after even an hour or so, it oxidized.   After wearing it a few days, and trying a few different primers (the Armani one included), I've discovered this just isn't the foundation for me. It feels like it melts off my face within a few hours and all you see is shine. Because of this, it also wasn't a great buildable foundation. It didn't do much to cover up my mild breakouts and rosacea. I imagine it would be great if you're looking for light coverage and have dry to normal skin.   I'm giving it two stars because hopefully, in the summer, the light coverage and the shade it turns when it oxidizes might be a perfect fit.

reviews.review_title: 52 years old - my Mature Skin HG Foundation
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Hooray! I'm still on the planet. Believe me, I am grateful for that. BUT, do I have to look so OLD while I am living the dream? I had been using It Cosmetics Your Skin but Better for several years. The shade 20.5 was a good match for my fair, cool/neutral skin. It wasn't heavy, applied easily and I am all for easy. However, lately my skin is really starting to show all those years without sunscreen, the 25 years of smoking before I quit 5 years ago, the laxity that comes with aging and...yay! deeper wrinkles. I just wasn't looking GOOD anymore. I started to panic a little. I started looking tired and washed out and felt ugly and old. I could see the freckles turning into age spots and melasma and I was making FREQUENT trips to Sephora looking for the right foundation to go with my new skincare regimen (and I have been using a sunscreen faithfully under my makeup ever since ELF came out with their moisturizing sunscreen). I was watching a lot of YouTube and reading reviews after reviews.  Somewhere along the way I started seeing a repeat for mature skin and the Armani Silk foundation.  I had already exchanged foundations so many times at Sephora; God love them for their patience.  So I went back yet again, and got a color match but they were out of stock with my color at all 3 nearby stores. So I ordered online and took another chance. I about DIED from joy when I took some selfies and compared them to the one from a couple of days ago. (Sorry, I could only upload 2 pics). This in my kitchen with overhead fluorescent can lights, at night! No primer, no filters, just moisturizer and beauty blender applied foundation. There is no smell that I could detect.  It feels like there is nothing on my skin. (No greasy looking transfer to my phone either). It took 2 pumps that come out about the size of a dime to do my full face. Yes - I can feel the money spend with that second pump, but the payoff is so worth it.  It builds nicely, and evenly without texture.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Avoid if you have textured / discolored skin

I went to Sephora for a consultation, I was pointed in the direction of a thicker foundation (Fenty Beauty Pro Filter Soft Matte Foundation).  I started wearing the new foundation to my Christmas / New Year reunions, and my skin looks great in those pictures.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: Must buy- have struggled for YEARS but no longer
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: YEs!!!!! I have beyond combo skin that changes with the season, some patches dry as a bone and others so oily no foundation would stick, Ive been a makeup lover and researcher since i was 16 and over the past decade of trying foundations I gave up on anything working for me. This foundation changed everything- of course the one w the price tag, but it is so beyond worth it. A dab goes so far and another dab will give you full coverage. It lasts all day and I mean all day (I work 12 hours shifts often)- no creases, apparent transferring, and my fine lines and pores have always been an issue. With one swipe my pores are filled in, skin smooth and radiant, and it doesnt even seem to need powder although I always use. I am so beyond happy to find this, if anyone struggles with combo skin and finding their shade and have given up, save up to give this a try!!!! I wish I had tried this sooner, hoping this helps. One thing I will say is I got the wrong shade- Im a very very pale neutral undertone, chantilly from nars is my perfect shade, and I got 1.5 but 2 seems to be more of a true neutral undertone. Thanks for reading and I hope this helps someone!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin

The pump is small, so 3 pumps are needed for a full face but it doesn‚Äôt feel cakey and the finish is nice and dewy. Definitely recommend if you want to splurge!

If you have dry skin like I do, this would be a good option for you. I have applied it with both a brush and a damp sponge. both look great! I prefer the damp sponge even though it soaks up more product. it is definitely a pricey foundation, but I think think it's worth it. You can spend more money trying different products every week/month.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is supposed to give your skin a natural looking glow but it‚Äôs just too oily. It separated so quickly, it feels nice at first on the skin then it just looks gross after like 2-3 hours

reviews.review_title: shade lighter than expected, get matched in store
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Very flexible range, you can get away with using up to 4 different shades and they would all work.  Received this foundation in a kit, but got the wrong shade. When I tried other samples in the store to exchange the shade, I noticed the shades seemed lighter than the description.   I tried 7.5, 7.75, 7.8 and 8. The shade 7.75 and 7.8 (which I thought would work for me) ended up being a little light for my complexion, and I wound up using Shade 8, which is perfect.   My advice is to go UP 2 shades or 3 even from your normal shade range. The shades seem lighter compared to similar shade descriptions for other brands.  It's a sheerer foundation, so using 4 different shades won't make a large difference.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Oily skin

I would recommend using 2-3 pumps to really see what this foundation can do. Beautiful for every day wear or for special events!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin

It's got great hold and doesn't move around throughout the day. It's not drying whatsoever as I find other foundations to be. A little goes a long way - it's well worth the money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is absolutely my holy grail foundation and is 100% worth the price. It's lightweight, luxurious and a little product goes a long way. Each bottle lasts me a couple months so I feel like I'm getting my money's worth. I truly feel like I'm not even wearing makeup sometimes with this product. My skin literally GLOWS from within when I use this. One of my friends even said I looked airbrushed the other day when I was wearing this.   I also love that this brand continues to add additional shades to accommodate to all skin tones. The shade 7.8 didn't exist until recently and it's a PERFECT match for someone with tan skin with olive undertones. Not a lot of brands do a great job catering to those with olive undertones.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin

I work in television and so many MUA's will never be caught without this formula and I get it. It's that perfect medium to buildable coverage but the finish is skin like with a slight glow - perfect for being photographed or filmed. If I need a foundation that I know won't get weird on me for events, it's always this one I fall back on. It never fails.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I noticed that the foundation brand  I had been using for years didn't look natural on my skin anymore and researched and learned  about this one so I went to the Sephora store and purchased it the same day.  I was amazed how natural and radiant my face looked, my sister saw me and tried it  on her and bought if for herself, my hairdresser who is a make- up fanatic kept asking me what I was using and when I told her she went straight to the website and ordered it for herself as well.  It's so great to find something like this, in the past finding the right foundation has been quite a trial and error and frustration.

reviews.review_title: The title doesn't reflect the finish (9)

Colour 9 (tan to deep, olive) gives a grey cast which is not how I want to look in life. That being said, I may try 8.75 if it's more golden, but shopping online doesn't give one a chance to test things out. What IS good: doesn't settle into fine lines, doesn't oxidise into mud, buildable coverage. What's not good: dries my face out (I'm 50, with dry skin), not at all luminous or perfect glowy in any way shape or form, has a grey cast (perhaps with this particular colour). I would not recommend this for dry skin, but I can see this working for combo or oily skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I thought the color was going to be off but it‚Äôs perfect. It goes on with a soft look and I had a customer let me know it looked flawless, while I was at work. Lasted all day looking good.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: My new favorite foundation. I just wish it wasn‚Äôt as expensive. I finally got a perfect shade match. I noticed that I only need a small pump to cover my whole face. Very pretty on the skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Normal skin

Really really big fan of this one

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve used this for years and there‚Äôs no way that they haven‚Äôt changed the formula. It‚Äôs not as much coverage, doesn‚Äôt last as long and looks splotchy. It used to be the holy grail
Overpriced, doesn't last longer. The bottle wasn't full at all, not much product for this amount of money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is overpriced.  It's not any better than some of the tinted BB or CC creams I've used in terms of coverage and/or creating a more even skin tone.  I would not buy this again.
Amazing amazing foundation, the shade is literally perfect and it goes on so smoothly and looks exactly like skin. Could not be more obsessed, worth the money

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful color and finish. It is light weight but evens out my skin tone. Not greasy at all.

reviews.review_title: Wish this didn‚Äôt break me out!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wanted to love this so bad because this foundation was my JAM for soooo many years, I started trying other foundations and when I came back to this one (even though i only wear foundation once or twice a week during weekend plans or date nights) It started breaking me out so bad with deep hard cystic acne for my generally very clear skin. At first I thought it was my hormones but once i noticed a trend and stopped using it, my skin is clear again!  Very sad because I love the way this foundation makes my skin look completely flawless. On to try the more expensive Koh gen do aqua foundation

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Dry skin

reviews.review_text: I have extremely oily skin so I generally avoid all makeup products with the word Luminous in their name. The foundation really does feel like skin and while it's 'luminous' it doesn't make me look oily. At the end of a busy day my foundation had barely smudged. The coverage is light-medium which is perfect for me. It feels weightless on the skin. I have only good things to say about it and I'm very happy with my purchase. The foundation shade match is also perfect on me. I'll definitely be buying this again when I run out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I finally found the right shade for me (9). I am a brown girl with a medium deep skin tone. This foundation is beautiful and natural. I will continue to repurchase this and it is worth every penny. It is not super full coverage but you can add more layers to achieve this effect. Its more dewy and radiant and looks best when you apply a thin coat. For best results prep your skin and make sure it's hydrated. I am using this with chanel powder and I love the final finish. I will be wearing this on my wedding day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation!  Goes on well with brush, sponge or fingers. Doesn‚Äôt sit in wrinkles and hold up on super hot days. I have combo skin with very dry cheeks/jaw and oily t-zone and I was afraid this would accentuate the occasional dry patch. It does not. It also doesn‚Äôt sit in my marionette lines or fine lines at the corners of my eyes. I think this is a great choice for mature skin too. Worth the price!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin

I even got compliments at the office on Day 1 ‚Äî and someone on teams asked if I was doing something different. I‚Äôm somewhere between fair and light so can never get color right ‚Äî either too dark or too light but this worked for me.

I don‚Äôt like mattes due to my combo-dry skin and I don‚Äôt like tinted moisturizers because they almost always contain spf and as someone who wears spf every day, you can‚Äôt mix spf products so that‚Äôs out. I‚Äôve bought this twice now since their reformation and it‚Äôs awful. It sits on my face. It takes ages to blend in now with a beauty blender takes forever to dry and if you use a brush it just won‚Äôt blend. It‚Äôll just be streaks all over your face. I hate what they‚Äôve done to this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Sooooo disappointed. Worked with a specialist at Sephora to find the best foundation for my aging skin, so after a few options went with the Armani product. In store it looked OK, but when I got home, all I saw in the mirror was every rough texture and line magnified. And this was AFTER an excellent primer had been applied before the foundation. Just to check my sanity, I looked at my skin after I washed it off later this evening. My skin looks MUCH better WITHOUT the foundation. So I guess the trade off is: you can even out discoloration BUT you will see exaggerated texture. I have a little discoloration, but covering that with this product makes my skin texture issues EVEN MORE prominent. So, if your goal is even color for a distant photo or something or if you want even color and have perfect/smooth texture, then this product might be for you. If you have ANY texture issues (dryness, flakes, large pores, wrinkles, fine lines, etc.) then forget this product and save your money. It only exaggerates bad texture. On a side note, I am very disappointed with several independent beauty product review sites that tout this product. Will be returning my unopened product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

Mixed this shade and a lighter shade and made it work, but wow this foundation has blown me away. Skin still looks great hours later, feels and looks like nothing on and my t-zone is not an oil slick. Only con I have is it doesn‚Äôt smell the greatest but it doesn‚Äôt linger on my skin. I looked dry and patchy, settled glaringly into tiny pores, and looked chalky.  There was absolutely no luminosity to it on my skin.  I tried it with primers and without primers, and the respult was the same -- my skin looked powdery and dry.  And what's worse, it FELT uncomfortably dry and powedery while I was wearing it.  I can't speak to its longevity because it looked so awful and felt so awful I washed my face.     This product is NOT for dry skin.

reviews.review_text: Woah, this lightweight yet beautiful natural finish is everything I never knew I needed. I have loads of foundations as a MUA, but this is so pretty on the skin. I had a great skin day and a wonderful makeup day wearing this to brunch. One of the Sephora Beauty Advisors told me to show her a picture when I wear this lol. I don‚Äôt know why this was never under my radar. I have everything from Pat McGrath, all of NARS‚Äô foundations, Fenty, Make Up For Ever, Hourglass, etc. This foundation has been the most lightweight next to Pat McGrath. I‚Äôm so happy I bought the mini size as well. (Kudos to Armani for selling a mini size where I pack for travel).  The proof is in the name, it is truly FLAWLESS! I‚Äôd say if you have been waiting for this, just go ahead and buy it my love, you will love. I see the hype. Now I have to figure out how I will add this to my kit lol.  Follow me on IG gentlestormwyatt for more pictures and videos. Muahhhhh

Im not sure if it is just the primer I use or the formula of the foundation. I am going to try another primer and see how long I get. I apply with a beauty blender. I have used a foundation brush but I did not like the way it applied.

reviews.review_title: worst foundation I‚Äôve ever tried, don‚Äôt buy
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Worst foundation I‚Äôve ever tried. I got it as a sample with my online order and decided to try it. It literally slid off my face within 2 hours and made my face an oily mess. If I am going to make such an expensive purchase, I would expect the foundation to last. Save your money and avoid this foundation. I‚Äôve tried drug store foundations that were way better. Extremely disappointed in it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: 4.5 stars  Received a sample of this with a recent order and was excited to try a cult classic. Shade 2 was a decent match for me, even though I would consider my skin more light than fair. Decided to apply with a foundation brush after my skincare and supergoop unseen sunscreen (also amazing). Blended beautifully and was easy to obtain a light even layer. I have combo skin with some faint acne scarring and this gave skin-like medium coverage. Has a lovely satin/glow finish without being shiny or oily. Ended up doing some yard work where I got sweaty, wore a hat, and had a gaiter over the lower half of my face. Removed these after hours of work to find that my skin still looked fresh with no creasing, smudging, and with very little transfer to the gaiter touching my face. I see why this is as hyped as it is. 4.5 stars for price and for the minor creasing under eyes. Obsessed

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely loved this foundation better than I thought I would! I usually use too faces or charlotte tilbury and this looks SO good on! Very much worth it! My foundation didn‚Äôt look heavy , cakey, or dry. It looked amazing!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It was ok but nothing amazing about it especially for the price. It also has a weird smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was pretty excited to try this after reading reviews. I can now say that this is NOT worth the price!!! I‚Äôve been using Est√©e Lauder double wear for years, and wanted to try something different. This foundation is thin and runny, and the coverage is questionable. This foundation is for people who already have perfect skin with nothing to hide. Won‚Äôt ever buy this again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation caused irritation and breakouts on my skin. I am 36 years old and use the same skin care routine consistently. The only thing I changed is using this foundation. The finish for me with his product looked patchy/uneven whether applied with a brush, beauty blender, or my fingers. I wanted it to work based on other positive reviews I have seen on this product so I tried different application/setting techniques and with each it failed to meet my expectations. I will say my expectations were high given the price point and reviews from others. A few hours into wear this product melts right off. There is a lot of transfer (onto mask) even with a setting spray. The finish did look skin-like, however, it looked more like a bad skin day (redness/uneven) than a flawless skin day for me. A foundation that actually gives me a flawless, blurred, even, skin-like, and long-lasting wear is the Urban Decay Stay Naked Foundation. I will be going back to that foundation. It gives the finish (at least for me) I think I was hoping for/expecting from this product with no irritation/breakouts and with a lower price tag.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: this has potential to be five stars. it is so beautiful on the skin. it is light weight, shade match was excellent, and it gives you a subtle glow. but it falls short because of the longevity. it looked beautiful for the first 4 hours but after that it began to sink in to pores and look extremely worn down. which is not good for someone who wears makeup for as long as 10 hours a day. If your days wearing makeup are extremely short then I would recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have rosacea, damaged skin barrier, dry and somewhat flaky skin.   this did not go on smooth, it clung to my flaky skin, immediately sat on top of pores while barely covering the skin around it (i looked like i had whiteheads on all my pores and a smeared foundation on the rest of the skin in natural light). I used a sponge and brush to test it out.  I did test it on non damaged skin like my forearm and it went on smoothly.  / beautifully.  I received a sample with my Sephora order.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this foundation. I‚Äôd say it‚Äôs a lightweight foundation with medium coverage. Blends super easy.  Just overall an excellent foundation.

reviews.review_title: Perfect! I will never buy a different foundation!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Wow! I am in love!   I have had the hardest time finding a good foundation for my very dry skin!! Granted, in the past I never spent more than $15 for foundation other than IL Makiage and even though I did my research to try and find my matching shade for IL; alas, I could not. Plus, it was just too thick and goopy. And no matter what I put on before the IL foundation, all my dry skin showed through!  Next up, Armani Luminous Silk and 'wallah'... pure MAGIC! Light to Medium coverage. All other foundations show my dry, peeling, cracking skin but not this one! And it has a nice, attractive sheen to it! Finally, my quest to find the best foundation is complete!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This has been my favorite foundation for years, I don‚Äôt even know how many times I‚Äôve rebought it. Great coverage and doesn‚Äôt clog pores.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin

I‚Äôm 43 years old so I had given up the idea of a holy grail.  I have found a couple that are really good but not that one that‚Äôs perfect EVERYTIME, this is that foundation.  Just beautiful, perfect match for my skin.  Melts right into my face and stays there without a setting powder even.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: It is beautiful, but not so much for dry and acne skin. This also wears as more of a BB Cream! If you have skin that is hydrated, clear, and non textured, this will be a great one!

reviews.review_title: Lightweight, radiant but not wet looking.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For shade reference, I‚Äôm NC17 in MAC studio fix, 3N in Charlotte Tillbury Airbrush Flawless, and 2W1 in Est√©e Lauder Double Wear.   I love this foundation so much. It‚Äôs everything I was looking for. I was originally using the L‚Äôoreal Pro Glow (shade 201) for my natural, glowy skin looks but this is significantly more lightweight and controlled in luminosity. You can definitely build up the coverage or keep it light for that tinted moisturizer-type of look. I love it for my everyday work makeup, it doesn‚Äôt cling on to my dry patches or sit in my lines either. I use the Milk Hydrogrip primer with it, and it‚Äôs just beautiful the way it lays on and lasts throughout the day. I‚Äôm combo/dry in some areas ever since I became pregnant and this has just given me the most natural, refreshed look. It did what the new NARS foundation couldn‚Äôt. I just love it so much.

I usually don‚Äôt have to touch up for being shiny (unless I get sweaty) and I don‚Äôt even own oil blotters. Very sad this didn‚Äôt work for me :(

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: Honestly I wanted to love this after seeing it multiple times hyped up on social media but I am so underwhelmed. reviews.review_title: Very, very sad :( formula has changed
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this foundation pretty much daily for over 12 years. That‚Äôs a lot of money I never once regretted spending because it kept my skin beautiful. Had a somewhat beach lotion smell which dissipated fairly quickly. The best part was that it never made me break out, and I‚Äôm pretty sure made my skin better those first few years. I just bought my very last bottle. It smells awful! I don‚Äôt know what they have done, but it smells like plastic. Ok, I could live with that. First day I wore it, at the end of the evening I had 2 pimples. Not a usual occurrence for me lately (thankfully, I paid my dues when I was younger). The following day after wearing it again, 2 more pimples. And a much oilier finish. I‚Äôm not doing anything different, nothing else is new, no new products, no new food. Just a new bottle of supposedly the same foundation I have been buying all these years. Except it‚Äôs not. What a shame! Bye Armani Silk Foundation, you were great. 3 stars for all the years of good service, 2 stars off for Armani ruining a great thing. Sorry for the long vent, my husband doesn‚Äôt understand why this sucks, so I can‚Äôt complain to him.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

Although I still have trouble with dry spots (working on my skincare) this is by far the best looking foundation I‚Äôve tried. My skin looks smooth and silky. 100% magic in a bottle.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have combination skin and I love this foundation.  It‚Äôs lightweight and it doesn‚Äôt amplify pores or fine lines.  Perfect for everyday.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Let me start off by saying that I love Armani beauty, just not this product for myself.  I have always used Power Fabric foundation because it covers my redness and blemishes flawlessly.  However, my skin has cleared up so much in the last 6 months that I felt like I needed something lighter.  I have heard rave reviews about this foundation so I decided that since I already loved Armani power fabric so much I would give this a try.  Honestly it looks terrible on my skin.  I have tried multiple primers and setting powders to see if it would make a difference and it still looks awful on me.  My pores are very visible and look magnified with this.  I even tried a pore clearing mask and a pore minimizer because I wanted to love this, but it just doesn‚Äôt go with my skin :(   I‚Äôm not going to entirely give up on it just yet because I feel like there has to be something out there that will make it work, but until I find it I think I will stick with my power fabric.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It‚Äôs not great for dry skin it wasn‚Äôt the best option for my skin a lot of hype, better options out there.

reviews.review_title: Sunning, but needs to be buffed with a brush
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation but the application method really matters. It's best applied with a brush in very light layers (I use the It Cosmetics Heavenly Luxe Complexion Perfection brush). It really doesn't work well with a beauty blender, but when buffed into the skin it's absolutely gorgeous; it has the most beautiful, natural finish I've ever seen in a foundation. And the longevity is amazing, virtually no transfer to a mask. I have a nearly impossible skin tone to match - everything either looks too pink or too yellow on me. The shade 2 fair peach is PERFECT. If you have neutral skin that doesn't seem to match anything, try the peach undertone. My old go-to was the original formula of the Makeup Forever Ultra HD, but the new formulation has ruined it for me. This is even better and I hope it never gets discontinued. Totally worth the splurge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I tried this a few yrs ago now that muffe ultra hd is no more thought I‚Äôd try again‚Ä¶just don‚Äôt get the great reviews nothing special, I‚Äôm 43 with some drying in winter and fine lines, there are better options especially at this price point not impressed

reviews.review_title: Not sure why all the rage and sell outs

reviews.review_title: my skin feels like silk, in love!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was pretty skeptical to buy a foundation that was over $60, especially because of all the mixed reviews I‚Äôve seen. Although I must say, I went ahead and bought it and I am so happy I did! I am pretty light and cool/pink undertones, and shade 4.75 was beautiful & perfect for me! I‚Äôd say this is a true medium coverage foundation, so if you are looking for a full coverage, I‚Äôd recommend Est√©e Lauder 24 hour foundation, that is a good one for full coverage. Anyhow, I love how this foundation feels on my skin, it really does feel like silk and I‚Äôm not even exaggerating, the name is perfect for it! I pair it with my tarte ultra creamy shape tape concealer and just tried pairing it with my new hourglass airbrush concealer this morning and I have to say both pair very well with this foundation! I think I‚Äôd like to try and get the Armani concealer next and see how that looks together since it‚Äôs recommended to use together. I feel so beautiful when I wear this foundation and I just cannot get over how well the shade matches my skin! When I do a full face make up look this weekend I will post another review with a picture so you guys can see this amazing-ness that I am speaking about‚Ä¶ so stay tuned!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

When you hold the two bottles side by side you would expect the same undertone, just a lighter color but they are obviously different. The 6 shows a bit green and the 3.5 is orange compared to it.  I had to return it and switch to a Light Golden 4 which I will probably just mix with the 6.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a wonderful light to medium coverage foundation! I have been using bb creams or tinted moisturizers the last few years. I loved elf‚Äôs BB cream because it was enough to cover/blend dark spots and acne scars, but also let my real skin shine through a bit. I also like moisturized/dewy VS. Matte. Now that my favorite bb cream is never in stock, I asked for a rec from a friend and she suggested this one. Needless to say, it‚Äôs a big price jump. But I do really love this! Coverage is just what I want, I still spot conceal any stubborn acne but it covers any scars or pigmentation. It stays all day (ALL DAY), and blends without any lines or oxidation. You do need to moisturize well or use something dewy (glossier futuredew for me) to really get that glow, but it definitely isn‚Äôt harshe matte by itself. Picking a shade was tough Online because I‚Äôm not used to so many undertone options. I‚Äôm pretty fair, couldn‚Äôt decide my undertone, so I went to store for shade matching. Even though I could probably get away with a few different shades, matching in store with the matching technology confirmed the one I was leaning toward. And a little goes a LONG way with this foundation, so I think it will last a long time. I‚Äôll be buying again!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the best foundation I have ever used outside of Napoleon Perdis Babydoll (no longer avail in US). This is smooth, lightweight, has a perfect color for my skin with a golden undertone, and reflects light subtly without looking glossy and weird or feeling greasy like so many ‚Äúglow‚Äù ‚Äúluminous‚Äù type products. For the perfect daily use I mix 1:1 or 2:1 with my moisturizer and apply liberally. My skin looks much better and  it looks like I am not wearing makeup. I have very sensitive skin and this has not caused any redness or irritation. Also I can wear this color with a slight suntan or when I am more pale and it always disappears. Perfect. 100 stars!

It‚Äôs great for a ‚Äúbuildable‚Äù foundation, although slightly more runny than I‚Äôd ever expect. I‚Äôve tried, & owned, many high end foundations & this just didn‚Äôt do it for me. Looks great the first few hours, but as we naturally touch our faces, then add a mask on top, well your going to lose your makeup. NARS is so much better & a better price point. Yes, I was wearing a setting spray & still had issues that I don‚Äôt with others. Invest your $$$ elsewhere!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: my favorite foundation!! The coverage is so smooth & beautiful and gives me a glowy look without looking greasy. It makes my skin look so even and radiant! The best part is it doesn‚Äôt make me break out (even when I accidentally forget to take my make up off at night).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation creates a very beautiful natural finish no matter what I use for application: Fenty Precision Makeup Sponge, or fingers, doesn't matter. I prefer a very light coverage application, so I cannot say how this would hold up if I needed fuller coverage. It's just barely scented, and inoffensively. It sits well by itself or with a setting powder over it (I use MAC Blot). I tend towards oilier, so the powder helps it last a lot longer. Even without powder, it doesn't clog my pores, nor does it look like it's separating throughout the day (in fact it looks surprisingly glowy after some oil starts appearing by early afternoon). It does start moving and collecting around the nose once the oiliness sets in late day, but no foundation is impervious to that.  I would highly recommend this to anyone with normal, combination, or oily skin. I'm fairly on top of exfoliation, so I cannot say if this has ever clung to dry patches (though I find that no foundation holds up if you have dry skin, so I would be amazed if this was an exception).  Application goes on very smoothly. This is NOT a thick formula, nor does it run like a watery tint. It's more moist than MAC or NARS Foundations, in my experience, but not quite a hydrating lotion. It doesn't tend to dry before I'm finished applying, and I live in a very dry climate.  I have not worn this during a hot sweaty humid summer yet, so I cannot review for that climate. Currently it is a crisp and dry autumn, and it's holding up well throughout day and evening wear.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Used it for an entire week and saw that it had good coverage. I do have oily skin and although it says its an oil free foundation I did find myself extremely dewy after 5 hours. I just used powder to reset and was fine so if you do not mind setting this every 3 hours then it shouldn't bother you. Did notice that out of all foundations I use this one was the one that most transferred onto my mask. For the price I expected more but it does provide nice coverage. Probably will not repurchase since I would rather pay less for other foundation that work way better.

reviews.review_title: Nice formula but not a lot of coverage.

It provides incredible coverage and makes my skin feel luxurious! It‚Äôs silky and blends great. It gives a matte finish. Pricy but worth it! A little goes a long way too!

reviews.review_text: This is a gorgeous foundation! I cannot recommend it enough for everything from daily wear to special occasion makeup. It has solid medium coverage but is buildable. When applied with a beautyblender, it‚Äôs hardly detectable on the skin so it looks super natural - like you‚Äôre not wearing any foundation at all.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really like it. I have a medium complexion, with yellow undertones (NC30) and purchased 6.25. My skin is oily so I used moisturizer, then Supergoop Mattescreen and CT Airbrush Flawless setting powder to set. I think without the Mattescreen this foundation would be a little too shiny for me. It has a natural finish which I like, medium coverage, and blends well.  After applying powder on top, it's perfect. I'm sure I'll repurchase but only when it's on sale as the price is pretty steep. I do have to blot and re-powder after several hours but that's nothing new and the foundation itself still looks really good. My other go-to is Lancome Teint Idole..I would say they're comparable on my skin.

reviews.review_title: nice finish but not for me
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got color matched for this foundation by a Sephora employee who was wearing a flawless makeup look, but the one she recommended was several shades too dark and orange in the sunlight. I have a very light/olive complexion, so I swapped it for shade 4 Golden, which was almost a perfect match, but a little pink looking. I have very dry skin due to the climate and was also told to avoid anything matte from settling into my pores, fine lines, and any scarring and and that this type of foundation would be better suited for my skin. I liked the finish and it made my skin look more even, however I felt like it made any scarring look more prominent due to the dewy sheen it left, I used Mineral Fusion powder sunscreen over it and that solved the issue to a degree. This also turned out to not be enough coverage for me since I have hyperpigmentation and found it rather sheer despite trying to build up the coverage by reapplying a few times and it did not have any staying power for me, so I ended up returning it. I‚Äôm sure this would look really amazing on good skin and/or skin with minor damage. So far the Clinique Even Better Makeup (not the newest serum one) is the only one I found that blurs imperfections and makes scarring less noticeable.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm not sure what the hype is with this stuff, it gave me horrible cystic acne breakouts all over my face. I‚Äôve done accutane/ use the strongest prescription retinoids,  and while still mildly acne prone, this gave me the worst breakouts I‚Äôve had in many many years. The shade range is odd too, almost impossible to find the exact right shade. Returned!! I can‚Äôt even say I liked the coverage either‚Ä¶. Was very light not worth it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin

Also does not cake up like most of the other pricey brands I tried. I do not have any sensitivity issues so I can‚Äôt speak for that but this foundation is amazing for me. Worth the price!

reviews.review_text: I have NEVER found a foundation that matched so perfectly. It is FLAWLESS as well. I usually don't wear foundation because I just get frustrated with the mis matched color and the feeling of having something on my face. This truly feels light and sets just like my skin. I don't even know I have it on! This will be the only foundation I every wear again. I am glad they had the mini size so I could try it out. Super happy with this!

reviews.review_title: Pure perfection, it's hard to believe
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: By far my favorite foundation I have ever tried. I really love Givenchy powder foundations, all of them. Same with Guerlain's powder foundations. They are so beautiful and last all day. Sometimes I like to wear liquids, but I can never find the perfect match or one that doesn't break me out. I got a sample of this with Sephora's complexion sample offer, so I tried this one in 5.5. Before I got my correct shade, 5.5 appeared full coverage. I could pull it off, but once my acne scars clear up, it'll be fine using my match which is 5.1. It does state this being medium coverage, though, and I would agree. I was looking at the Power Fabric before I chose this one. Both have some mixed reviews, so I went with this one because I was able to try it first. Plus, this honestly looked a lot more on the matte side than luminous which I am super happy about. I have no doubt I'd love the Power Fabric, but The Neo Nude isn't that great as it doesn't last all day like this one. I can put this on in the early morning, no powder over it, and when I go to take my makeup off late at night, it still looks the same. I am very impressed. I have a semi-oily forehead in the summer, otherwise my skin is pretty normal. I've only applied this with my fingers, and I can't believe how perfect it looks. Also, you can't put too much on either! I wanted to test it, so I opened up another sample, and I kept layering and layering and it seriously remained the same. It was like magic, I had no idea where all the product was going haha, and I hate to think of that going into my skin.. This is foolproof: you can't put too little or too much, so you don't have to worry about it getting cakey. Highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The best foundation ever!!!! It's no wonder why lits of celebrities use it. It's buildable so soft and doesn't feel heavy.  This is a holy grail for sure!

reviews.review_title: Looks very nice, slightly difficult to work with

reviews.review_text: Pros: Absolutely beautiful finish that made my skin look glowy and radiant without looking sweaty. Amazing lasting power, stayed on all day without budging. Didn't settle into fine lines too much.  Cons: It's difficult to apply evenly, has a tendency to build up coverage very quickly, so you have to spend a lot of time blending it out to get it to look even. I would say it clings to dry patches slightly and emphasizes pores a little bit (not a lot, just slightly more than some foundations I've used). It definitely takes a lot of work to perfect the application of this foundation when compared to sheer/buildable formulas.   Another thing to note is that it's somewhat difficult to find your best match with this foundation since the shade numbering system isn't very intuitive (some shades are darker than shades with a higher number)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this foundation for almost seven years and truthfully, don‚Äôt have one bad thing to say. Previously, I was using Nars sheer glow and I found it would give me really aggressive flash back in photos, it was far more oily - to the point that, my normally somewhat dry skin would be greasy and my makeup would always look gross by the end of the day. I‚Äôve tried a decent number of other foundations (Dior face and body, Fenty pro filt‚Äôr hydrating foundation, Gucci Fluide De Beaut√©  - to name a few) and nothing, I mean literally NOTHING makes my skin look the way luminous silk does. If you‚Äôre someone with cooler undertones - this ones for you. I have olive, medium, cool tone skin... and what my quest for the perfect foundation has taught me, is that most companies, while they have a cool, neutral and warm option in most shades. The cool colours are still too orange or will oxidize by the end of the day, leaving you with a completely different color face (I can‚Äôt tell you how much I love leaving for work, only to realize halfway through the day that I‚Äôve morphed into a jersey shore reject). Luminous silk is the only foundation that TRULY matches my skin. It blends seamlessly, you don‚Äôt require a lot of product to get a beautiful full face (for every day use, I‚Äôll usually use about half a pump and if I‚Äôm going full glam, I‚Äôll use 2), it‚Äôs super easy to build up if you want it to be more full coverage and the finish is juuuust gorgeous. I‚Äôve never seen my skin look more radiant, even, glowing and still look like MY skin. If you‚Äôre at all thinking about purchasing this product - pull the trigger! Trust me, you will not regret it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I tried so many foundations before buying this one. To name a few: Estee Lauder, Urban Decay, Il Makiage, Mac, Laura Mercier, Nars, Lancome, Ilia. They were all superb products, but I couldn't find a shade match for my olive skin, which left me feeling super disappointed and discouraged. I either looked too orange, neutral, or yellow. I had heard it takes a while to find the one you fall head over heels for ;), but gosh, I wasn't expecting this....  It's such a beautiful foundation. Feels super lightweight, and spreads so easily. It doesn't dry on the face super quick, and it has the most natural finish without compromising coverage. I don't have blemishes or textured skin, but I do struggle with an uneven tone, and this works wonders. It plays well with all my other products, and I appreciate that it fades slightly by the end of the day. It's resilient enough that it stays put during/after my daily gym visit, so I'm happy.   Obviously the price is a drawback, but I w/e, it got me out of my rut. Will definitely be repurchasing.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Been hearing about this foundation raved about for years, but finally went on a limb to try it this year. Wow. I‚Äôm sure it wouldn‚Äôt have worked for me back then, but i love it now!! (I was all about full coverage and matte foundations back then bc of my skin‚Äôs condition and oiliness, but now my skin has evened out a lot - still have freckles/melasma and skin has become more dry combo). This foundation is a true medium coverage, but lightly veils my freckles which I‚Äôm now ok with. Otherwise, it enhances my skin well. I use my sunscreen/tatcha silk liquid primer underneath and they work quite well together. This foundation definitely isn‚Äôt budge proof with mask on and an extra muggy hot day in TX, but otherwise it wears great and doesn‚Äôt become oily or slide off my face! Also really impressed with how great it looks in photos. Not sure how to describe it - skin looks smooth and has a healthy subtle glow. For more glow that‚Äôs still fairly natural, I layer my hourglass ambient lighting powder in ethereal over this. Started off with the wrong color #5, then went down to 4.5 which matched pretty close to my neck. Never feels cakey or looks heavy, just looks pretty close to skin for me. This and the dior forever glow are my favorites. Definitely will repurchase the Armani silk again!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the holy grail of full coverage liquid foundation. Literally the ONLY one I‚Äôve ever tried in my life that looks good both indoors and in the sunshine. It melts in with skin so perfectly and isn‚Äôt oily or drying. I will never switch foundations again

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, gray hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've been dying to try this HG foundation for a while and decided to treat myself with the mini for my birthday. It didn't disappoint.  First, the color is the best matching foundation I've ever used. Ever. That alone was worth the price tag.  At 53 I'm trying to find a more natural finish than my ELDW can provide, and this is it.  A little goes a long way here and yet the coverage is perfect for not looking overdone. I'm a solid medium to full coverage gal, yet this one gives me a bit more sheer that doesn't leave me unhappy. It covers what I need covered and doesn't show what I don't want showing.  The Cor match is so good I had to look in my 10x mirror to convince myself I had product on my face. First time user I matched by the description given here.  Light is too light, I'm not quite medium, and light medium neutral was my correct guess.  I used a damp blender and would wear this out to a fancy event without worry.  It's not a long wear foundation but gets me through my day.  I've had to realize that long wears just don't work well over 50. Because I bought the small one this isn't my daily driver, but I'm buying the full size because I love it that much.  It's similar to The Ordinary Serum Foundation, which I also love, but this color match is the selling point here for me.  Love it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I like this foundation, but it has a few issues for me. I have combination skin with surface dryness, and some redness on my nose and forehead. This foundation gives a very pretty silken finish at first, but the coverage only lasts about 4 hours for me. Then my redness shows. It doesn't emphasize my pores, but does cling to some surface dryness. I like that it is oil-free and has a good shade range. I read one reviewer compare it to a tinted moisturizer in coverage and I would say this is pretty accurate. Shade 3 is almost too light for me, and it oxidizes a bit. I wear Nars tinted moisturizer in Finland, and Estee Lauder Double Wear 1N1. If you're interested in this one I'd recommend getting a sample first, and then maybe the mini bottle since a full size is pricey.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve tried so many foundations from affordable to expensive and this foundation is the best in the game.Its so beautiful,it doesn‚Äôt feel heavy at all and is very buildable.Its not as full coverage but rather a very nice coverage to even out the skin giving you a nice healthy glow. All the MUAs use this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_title: Not worthy of the price or the hype
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I haven't worn liquid foundation in a very long time - I have been a loyal GloSkin Beauty pressed base user for 15 years. I wanted to go with a top of the line foundation for my first experience back with a liquid base. Extremely disappointed!! First of all, not very good coverage. I don't have any major things to cover, but it didn't minimize even the minor thigs, like cheek redness. It sits on the surface of the skin - no matter brush application, beauty blender (best), or fingertips, you can still see it sitting on the skin. Plus, any dry patches or large pores it accentuates. The wear is not great either - after half a day, it has settled into lines, even using a primer. My GloSkin pressed base makes my skin look so much better & is not noticeable on the skin. For the price point and all the awards, relly shocked how much I dislike this foundation. Soo bummed. Was looking for a beautiful foundation, but I don't look forward to wearing this at all. I have a whole bottle to get through - not going to waste it at that price. Too bad you can't sample things these days.

The only reason I took away a star is that it has no spf so I have to put some on underneath and when I do that I have to let the sunscreen completely dry and then I have to apply the foundation with a brush and then blend it more with a Beauty sponge which is a lot of steps so that it lays on my skin with an airbrushed finish. If I don‚Äôt do these steps and I put sunscreen on it just sort of streaks and doesn‚Äôt look blended. However with no sunscreen it does fine.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: i have a hard time finding foundations that match my skin, and this is perfect! it‚Äôs not too pink/cool or too orange/warm, and it‚Äôs light enough to look natural on my very fair skin without making me look like a ghost. it also makes my skin look fresh and natural without being too dewy or glowy. i love a no makeup-makeup look and this enables me to do it.

reviews.review_title: Everything Screams NO!  Did I Get A Bad Batch?
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have heard rave reviews about this foundation for some time now, so finally ordered this. I was full of anticipation when I first tried it, and have to say that I'm one of the few, surprisingly so, who truly didn't like anything about it.  I didn't like the consistency, the texture, the coverage, or the look on my face.  I have pretty much tried most foundations out there...both high end and drug store, and I have to say that, at least on my face, it's one of the worst foundations ever.  Surprised?  Yes . . . as was I.  Because I'm one of the few who feels this way, I truly question whether I got a bad batch.  Very much disappointed!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got out of wearing foundation for over a decade because I got tired of how it would feel heavy and cakey, and I just preferred a no-makeup look. Now that I'm 30, though, I don't wear any makeup at all at work (as I work in healthcare, and it's just really not worth it), so I've been having fun dolling myself up a little more on the weekends. I wanted to try foundation again but didn't want anything heavy, I just basically wanted it barely there. I read many critical reviews of this, and while I almost always base my purchases from reviews, here the reviews were complaining about it being too sheer, bare, and lacking coverage...and other, positive, reviews saying how beautiful it wears...so I was like, Aha! That's the one for me! And maybe I'm biased because I don't like liquid foundation, anyway, but I absolutely love this foundation. It is hands-down the best liquid foundation I have ever used. Please Armani never stop making this, because I will keep making it forever. Also, I am a very pale white redhead, and the shade posted for this review is the PERFECT shade for me. It looks just like my actual skin, only perfectly luminous and poreless. I apply it with a Foundation brush, and it's perfect. Highly, highly, highly recommend to my fellow foundation-haters. Other folks may find the formula too sheer and lacking, but it's an A+ in my book.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The most beautiful foundation I‚Äôve ever used - and I‚Äôve used a lot! I‚Äôm ready to toss all the rest because this is the only one I think I‚Äôll ever wear again! It‚Äôs absolutely gorgeous, I honestly find it hard to describe because it just has that ‚Äúje ne sais quoi‚Äù. The price tag is also pretty breathtaking, and I almost deducted a star for it because for the amount you get it seems crazy. But so far I have found that a little goes a long way, and you can build coverage with this if you‚Äôd like. The range of shades is also something I appreciate, as an avid self-tanner. I hope this never leaves the shelves!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_text: I hate heavy foudations, it feels weird on me and I feel like this foundation is a STAPLE when it comes to natural looking makeup. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: my holy grail foundation!! i‚Äôve tried so many foundations and keep coming back to this one. it lasts all day, doesn‚Äôt break me out, feels light on my skin, very buildable,  it is a bit pricey but it‚Äôs truly so worth the money and it‚Äôll last you a long time.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Best foundation I have ever used. Not only does it leave my face looking good but also looks super healthy and vibrant. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this foundation for my light makeup days or more glow days . Now the shade that was recommended for me I don‚Äôt think it was a match. Is very orange . I‚Äôm more of yellow undertone.

reviews.review_text: If I could give this zero stars I would! For the price this foundation is awful. I've used cheap drug store foundations that hold up better than this. To start with the foundation applied okay, I did like the silky look right after application. However if you want a medium-full coverage you have to apply a generous amount. For something that cost $60 an up I would imagine it should make it longer than 4 hours without separating like it did.
