It evens out my rosacea areas and gives me that natural glow that I typically need to get from other products to use with my foundation.  As I like light coverage, a little goes a long way for me which helps me justify the high price tag along with it‚Äôs amazing finish.  Overall, Love the product...hate the price. But I justify it because of my low use due to lightweight coverage. Typically to get that luminous look you need a second or even third product to get those results so 1 product vs 2 or 3 offsets that cost. So in the end you get what you pay for which is an amazing product that I will buy again.

reviews.review_text: I have acne-prone combination skin, and I originally purchased this foundation per my esthetician's recommendation; she said this foundation is one of the few that won't cause breakouts. I also noticed that patches of my skin would often break through the foundation and that the foundation moved easily, even though I rarely touch my face and regularly use a setting powder. For $64, the patchiness and oily mess this foundation gave me made it not worth the money. I could see how the foundation could look lovely on dry/normal skin, but it is not a good fit for ladies with combination/oily skin, as the oil easily breaks through the foundation and the foundation moves very easily. I've had much better experiences with foundations that were a fraction of the cost.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was incredibly hesitant in buying such an expensive foundation, especially because I have a lot of trouble in finding foundations that don‚Äôt break me out. All other foundations I‚Äôve tried up to this point either make me break out, are super drying, or both and I‚Äôve had to return them. I have normal to dry skin and have some acne scarring, but nothing too dark or deep that‚Äôs too hard to cover up. My biggest issue with foundation is that I would get dry patches, but this foundation doesn‚Äôt do that at all to me. I‚Äôd say this foundation is more of a light to definitely buildable medium coverage. It‚Äôs like a second skin, I don‚Äôt find it to be heavy or really ‚Äúfeel‚Äù like I‚Äôm wearing a ton of make up. I don‚Äôt find that it slips off throughout the day, but I also don‚Äôt have oily skin so I‚Äôm not sure how that would work for those that do have oily skin. Shade 5 was a perfect color match for me, but I went in store and was shade matched, which is I would suggest doing especially for such an expensive foundation. If you‚Äôre hesitant in buying such an expensive foundation, I would go in store and get shade matched, and then buy the smaller size online (I don‚Äôt think they sell the smaller size in store, but I could be wrong). Or ask for a sample in your shade! Overall this has quickly become my favorite foundation and I would suggest everyone to give it a go! If you don‚Äôt end up liking it Sephora always accepts returns in a reasonable time frame and usage of a product, a policy which I have unfortunately had to take advantage of for multiple other foundations which I haven‚Äôt liked.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: O. M. G. I honestly have never loved a foundation the way I love this one. I was a tinted moisturizer girl before this - but this foundation is so natural looking and feeling that I don‚Äôt see why I shouldn‚Äôt wear this one all the time. I am so stoked on it. I had purchased my first color online which turned out to to be a little too light - so this morning I went into the Sephora in Waikiki to color match and exchange. And I just want to shout out to the lovely lady with glowing skin and luscious curly hair who helped me out while my 2 year old was crying. I loved the tip she gave me about using my fingers instead of a brush - that‚Äôs my favorite way to apply foundation anyways. I tried that in lieu of my high density flat kabuki brush and I feel the product ‚Äúbonded‚Äù with my skin much better. Anyways - BUY THIS FOUNDATION YOU WONT REGRET IT. oh and the reason I discovered it in the first place is because I read that this is the foundation the MUA for Game of Thrones used on all the characters. It‚Äôs so natural and perfect. I am clearly in love with it.

reviews.review_text: INCREDIBLE! If you want a lit from within and you also want your skin to still look like skin but the most perfect it can be....then you need to try this foundation! I am just shy of 46 and have normal to combo skin. This foundation does NOT settle into fine lines. It almost sits above them weightlessly. If I want more coverage, I‚Äôll use a foundation brush that is angled with a flat top head. I‚Äôll glide it on and then stipple a bit on my T zone area for extra coverage. It gives a lighter coverage but evens everything out and my skin looks lit and natural. This foundation can be whatever you need depending on how you choose the application and that‚Äôs AMAZING! reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Best foundation I have found for my skin, although it is not really for coverage but evening out skintone. I have dry patchy, textured skin with scarring. It never clings to patches and doesn‚Äôt break up on me. I do have to conceal with a full coverage concealer though, but the finish and look of this is so good. I have tried jouer, hourglass vanish, double wear, Nars sheer. This for me tops them

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Okay lets chat about this lil treasure right here. I'm one of those people that depends solely on reviews for survival but never leaves them myself, however this has been my glow-to (ha) foundation for 5 years now, and I figured I owed it a review. First, the texture is beautiful. Silky, creamy, velvety, blends like a damn dream. I have light-medium olive skin, and in the winter I look like a sickly jaundiced child from the Civil War era, and in the summer I look like like a coconut husk, and I am able to stick with the same shade during both seasons because it truly melts into the skin without leaving any weird splotches or demarcations. I have pretty oily skin, and while I will say it is a dewy finish, as long as you top with setting powder (Fenty or Laura Mercier are my go-to's) you'll be good even if you have an olive oil factory living underneath your epidermis like me.  So tips and tricks I've learned during my 5 year relationship with this foundation: If you're using cream contour/color correcting, do it first and then apply this with a damp beauty blender or a dense buffing brush. If you use a flat foundation brush you're booking yourself a 1 way ticket to streak city. I like applying my cream highlight underneath as well (currently using Milks Holographic stick thing) and then foundation, concealer, set with powder, and then all my other powder products (blush, more highlighter (lol) bronzer, etc).  USE. A. PRIMER. A silicone one. No they wont clog your pores as long as you use a light gel moisturizer underneath as a barrier. I promise. I use the Sol No Poreblem primer and its dope. If you don't use a primer, it will separate on your nose halfway through the day. Its buildable, blendable, it can be dewy or matte, no shimmer, and it doesn't oxidize. Like, at all.  Also, Sephora doesnt carry it in the store, but go to Saks, get yourself color matched, and then buy your shade on Sephora online for samples and points.

reviews.review_title: The worst for oily skin with zero staying power

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

I have been using tretinoin for the past 9 months my skin is pretty good at this point and I don't get as oily as I once did. I am in love! reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: The holy grail of radiant foundation
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: If you're looking for a natural, radiant glow with great coverage and an amazing finish, this is hands down the BEST foundation! I've tried them all: Nars, Too faced, Stila, Estee lauder, Fenty, Hourglass, etc. (you name it, I've tried it!). This blows them all out of the water. What I love so much about this foundation is that it matches my skin tone flawlessly and it feels as if nothing is on my face. I have combination skin with hormonal breakouts and it hasn't caused a break out and still covers my problem areas. It is a little pricey, but I ordered mine during the Sephora sale. It's worth EVERY penny!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I didn't want to like this. I really didn't. After over a year of hearing friends in an online community rave about it, I had to try it. And it's as phenomenal as you'd expect. I've used MUFE HD for 10 years. Loyally. Holy smokes does this blow it out of the water. Let me explain...  I'm an autistic woman, and part of that is having sensory issues. Make-up can feel really bothersome, and even though I love it, I REALLY hate the feeling of foundation. MUFE HD was the closest I've come to not really feeling it and getting the coverage I wanted. In slinks the luminous silk foundation...it feels like nothing is there. After 16 hours! My sensory issues with foundation are alleviated, and y'all don't know how much that seemingly small thing impacts my life! It makes a huge difference. I cried because I was so happy to finally find a product like this!  My main complaint is that I do have to use more than I use of MUFE HD to get the coverage I want. I think this might be because the formula is thinner overall.   I can't recommend it enough. It's definitely a luxury product, but it's something I'll be willing to spring for because of how it feels and the difference it makes in my comfort level.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is magical. It blends like a dream, has the perfect amount of coverage for my tastes and looks like luminous, beautiful skin. I always wear primer under my foundation and this lasts all day until I take it off. It's also super lightweight and feels like I'm wearing nothing at all. I usually use a foundation brush (Sephora #56) but it blends nicely with fingers too! I love it so much I almost don't even mind dropping the guap for it...almost.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have textured acne prone 35 yr old skin with acne scars, combo and oily t zone.  I usually go for a natural fresh dewy (not wet or greasy) radiant finish with makeup.  this in my opinion does not have a dewy radiant finish.  I'm no expert but it does provide a soft airbrush look which is fine with me.  it does not accentuate my texture or scars but it definitely does not hide them since this is not full coverage nor medium coverage.  I'm OK with this bc it softens/blurs out my skin and I look more even toned.  it's not oil controlling so my t zone does get greasy but blotting and powder always helps.  I believe this is better than the laura Mercier luminiere.  I plan on returning that one and buying another one of these instead.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin

However, the color, the consistency, and the effect are really beautiful. The price is too high for the drawbacks (for my skin, at least).

reviews.review_title: The only foundation I will use

I suppose that is relative, depending upon one's budget and priorities. I think it is, but I am also glad that my shade is available in the smaller, less expensive bottle, since a little goes a long way and I don't do a full face every day. I recommend it, but as always, try a sample first to see if it works for you.

reviews.review_text: This has been my go to foundation for several years now. I have combination skin with visible pores on my nose and an oily t-zone.  I wear this over moisturizer and tatcha primer in my t-zone.  It gives light to medium buildable coverage, doesn‚Äôt pill in combination with my other products, and lasts all day for me. I use Charlotte Tilbury setting powder and the combination has the subtle luminosity I‚Äôm looking for.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I used Sephora's shade finder to match the shade of the Dr Jart Black Label BB cream (my staple) with this foundation. Sephora listed color 4.5 as an EXACT match (not 'similar' or 'close' match) with the BB cream, but it was anything but. Shade 4.5 appeared more light-to-medium with warm/yellow undertones and the BB cream on me is more fair-to-light with neutral undertones. Understanding these are different solutions, which will show up differently on varying skin tones, this is more of a review for Sephora's Shade Finder feature than the Luminous Silk Foundation itself. Not an exact match, or even a similar/close one. I am sure the foundation itself is as luxurious as everyone makes it out to be, but now I am forced to go into the over-crowded Sephora store to find my match and exchange my current one. I am hoping Sephora will honor the price from the Rouge sale, but we'll see.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: All it's said to be and more!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: There of been a lot of new and old foundations presented to the market. But none of those foundations compare to the Giorgio Armani luminous silk foundation. It is without a doubt the best foundation for anyone who wears make up every day. It is extremely lightweight. It feels like you have a moisturizer on your skin.  It is a medium coverage foundation that allows your skin to show through. But I have found that it can be built into a heavier coverage if necessary. The feel the texture the quality of this foundation makes it hands and above all of its competition. Without a doubt this is the best foundation on the market. The other simply cannot compare. If you are looking for that airbrush appearance and feel to your make up this is the foundation to use. If you‚Äôve been searching for a quality foundation for as long as I have I assure you you will not be disappointed with the Giorgio Armani luminous silk foundation. It is well worth its price as a matter fact I would pay more for it. Try it you will not be disappointed.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: No idea why I ever try another foundation (and I‚Äôve tried a lot). I always come back to this one. My skin can be dry, more so in winter and this doesn‚Äôt clump or cake. A little also goes a long way. Worth every cent.

The formula is excellent and it provides a smooth finish while adequately covering up any discoloration and redness. I consider it medium coverage which looks very natural. It‚Äôs never cakey or drying, and it comes in a good variety of tones.  Another major plus is that it doesn‚Äôt irritate my sensitive and eczema prone skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is amazing. It glides onto the skin so effortlessly. I‚Äôm new to makeup and it was a breeze to use. It‚Äôs a little runnier than the other ones I have but that‚Äôs by no means a complaint. The shade is a perfect match and I could not be happier with it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Honestly this was the foundation I‚Äôve been wanting to try for as long as I can remember. Once I actually bought it, I was so disappointed. It wasn‚Äôt dewy at all???? It was drying? It cracked all over my skin, didn‚Äôt look good at all! It didn‚Äôt last all day too. The coverage is very light as well. This made me super sad.

reviews.review_title: finally the end of my search is here
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I've been on the hunt for the perfect (for me) foundation for years. I've found some that were decent and even some that I thought were near perfect or at least I thought that, until I tried this for the first time. the price tag scared me off, so when a friend bought this for me as a gift (she works for the company that distributes the Armani beauty line), I couldn't wait to try it. it's everything it claims to be and more. It is very lightweight, almost having a watery feel to it. that made me nervous as I have imperfections I struggle to cover (And still look natural). don't let the consistency of it fool you, it's buildable. It takes me only 2 pumps to build to full coverage but the amazing thing is it looks natural, like a second glowing skin! It doesn't cake or patch up. It is the easiest foundation I've ever applied with my beauty blender. And it truly lasts all day. And if you have oily skin (like me) and worry about the luminous part of it, dont! it's the only foundation that I've tried that is able to give a healthy, pretty glow without it ever looking oily or just gross.  All in all, I will gladly pay the hefty price tag for this foundation over and over again. it's that good! just a warning: the shade depicted in the product picture (of it in the bottle) appears darker in my opinion than it actually is. I wear 1W2 Sand in Estee Lauder and 2.5 in UD All Nighter and got shade 4 in this. It's perfect for my fall/winter tone but for summer I will shade up 1-2 spots.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had been eyeing this foundation for a while but never got around to trying it. I bought it on a whim and I am so glad I did. I have used this a few times already and it just gives me such a good skin day. It provides good coverage while keeping my skin looking natural and radiant. I love it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin

My skin tends to be combo, but falls towards the dryer end of the spectrum. Doesn‚Äôt melt off your face. It‚Äôs definitely sheer, but very buildable without looking cakey.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin

It‚Äôs light weight and coverage are incredible, your skin will feel like its for a newborn, and at the same time all of your beauty marks will show (which doesn‚Äôt happen with any other foundation I‚Äôve used before). Ok I talked too much but this is the best foundation ever and I highly recommend it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this foundation. It looks flawless is well worth the price

reviews.review_title: Beautiful formula, but needs a light olive shade

reviews.review_text: This is the BEST for dry skin. It is not dewy, it's not matte, it's a beautiful satin finish. This with the waleda skin food or the tatcha dewy skin cream underneath makes my dry skin look dewy and glowy. It lasts all day on my face and fades off nicely without looking patchy or cakey. My only gripe with this is the shade range. I have light skin with olive undertones, and I always struggle to find a shade that matches my skin. 4 is the closest I was able to get. If you have more medium skin with olive undertones, shade 6 is very olive but way too dark for me. If you're able to shell out the $$$ and mix two shades, try mixing 4 and 6 and you will get an perfect match for light olive skin.

reviews.review_title: I always come back to this OG.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin

This foundation is absolutely BEAUTIFUL. It's so light on the skin, feels like you have nothing on, yet.. still gives you the most beautiful coverage. I consider it a full/medium coverage.. because I build mine up to be more full but if you're into lesser coverage I still think you could love just a light layer. I know the price seems steep but these bottles do last me a long time and I HIGHLY recommend trying it!! At least grab a sample, you'll be hooked.

I finally decided to just go for it and bought a bottle and I have to say, I was pretty disappointed. I‚Äôll start with the pros/less negative parts; the coverage was ok, nothing amazing. It was moderately buildable and the finish wasn‚Äôt too glossy or matte, it was nicely in-between. I have combination skin, dry cheeks and a T-zone that tends to get oily so my biggest con was that it enhanced the dryness on my cheeks making it way more noticeable! It also started to break away and get cakey around my T-zone after a couple of hours. It also didn‚Äôt cover any blemishes or dark circles very well, even when I built it. Overall it was ok, but it wasn‚Äôt anything special. I can get the same results from much cheaper foundations (or BB creams), maybe even drugstore products, and that‚Äôs the problem. For this price, I expect my foundation to DELIVER and this one did not and for that reason, I decided to return it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: AMAZING If you want a foundation that doesn‚Äôt look cakey but has coverage then this is a must have

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love. This. Foundation! Medium coverage easily built to full. Sits beautifully on the skin. Does not settle into pores or fine lines. I have combo to oily skin and do not ever touch up my makeup during the day, and I experience only slight breaking up around the crease of my nostrils after 12 hours of wear, but just patting it out with my finger tip fixes it right up.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this foundation for about 5-6 months now, and I have never been happier with a foundation. It is so light, but gives good coverage. I am someone who does not like feeling cakey but wants good coverage with a nice smooth finish and this foundation definitely does the job. I have been pairing this with the Too Faced Born This Way concealer and love the combo! I am oily and can wear this foundation all day without looking greasy or extremely oily. I have found that baking in the T-Zone and then using a powder puff to set all over, after baking, really helps me out. I use the Laura Mercier setting powder with this and then finish with a setting spray when done. This foundation has become my absolute favorite and it is definitely worth the splurge.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation. I have super dry skin, yet a lot of glowy foundations tend to break up on me. This one stays looking beautiful all day, gets a nice natural glow to it as the day goes on. It surprisingly wears a really long time, my attached photos are after 9 hours of wear.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation so much and it really bums me out cuz its so expensive. The undertones are beautiful and they don't lean too yellow or pink, they are perfectly neutral. The coverage is medium but can be built up and the finish is so glowy and silky, I literally feel like a goddess whenever I wear this. If you like to mix your foundation with a concealer, let's say, to amp up the coverage this foundation is great for that, it plays well with others. I will keep repurchasing again and again.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is the best foundation I‚Äôve ever used !! I got this a little over 2 weeks ago and I can‚Äôt stop using it. I bought it just to try out and it totally replaced my old foundation born this way too faced! It‚Äôs my prefect shade match and it lasts for hours ! I put at 10am one day before work then went to the gym right after and it didn‚Äôt even budge ! I had people complimenting my skin all day! I will definitely be re-purchasing

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: the best foundation i've ever worn, it covers all my imperfections while being super lightweight and silky smooth, NOT cakey at all. gives me a very natural finish that looks like i don't have any foundation on but STILL does its job and covers all my imperfections. the best foundation i've ever used.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Came to Sephora to get Make up forever foundation but the sale assistant convinced me to try this one. It looked really good on my cheek, perfect for dry skin so I left home happy. Next day I put it on and there was absolutely no coverage at all. I don't know how many layers i put to look ok.. such a waste of money. I'll use this bottle in 2 weeks that way

reviews.review_title: Pore clogger and no ingredients disclosed!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Clogged my pores causing many blackheads, and the coverage pretty much disappears by midday. It‚Äôs a shame that they don‚Äôt disclose ingredients in this product to consumers who pay so much $$ without any knowledge of what crap they apply to their face on a daily basis!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation was okay. Definitely not worth the cost. There are way better ones out there for much less money. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: One of my favorite foundations.  I never liked this foundation when I first bought it due to the wrong shades match.  The shade is rather confusing.  Finally after all these years, I found a color that matches me after watching Sandra (YouTuber TTsandra) mentioning this is her shade.  This is a beautiful medium coverage foundation.  It looks good when I wear it during the weekend.  This is a weekend foundation for me because I am unsure of its longevity.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love this foundation!!! It‚Äôs the perfect natural finish foundation. Buildable coverage, lasts all day, and my skin looks so healthy. You can make it look dewy or more matte depending on how/what powders you use. Might try more foundations, but I would definitely repurchase this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: It wasn't the best foundation I've tried and I've tried about every foundation at Sephora. It did nothing for my skin. my skin didn't look nicer, healthier, etc.  I think is even heightened my pores that aren't even big to begin with. I have relatively good skin with little to no breakouts. I get a bit oily in my Tzone through out the day, but nothing a blotting sheet can't fix. This foundation had little to no staying power. I like a foundation that is not going to be moving around and this one did just that. It was way too dewy, it ate my contour, and managed to clog my pores. It did appear more skin like at first, but through out the day it seemed to just disappear. Keep in mind I'm a makeup artist that prepped her skin, and took all the steps to increase the longevity. It looked okay for the first 2 hours and then became a hot mess.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Fair skin tone, Normal skin

I bought the second lightest foundation that looked a lot darker than my skin and when it arrived the colour was way too pale compared to my skin after wearing this foundation for 4 hours it was like I was wearing nothing and take in this foundation is 3 times the price of my regular foundation. no thanks.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Waste of money, it made me breakout

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've tried many brands and at first couldn't tell much difference just looking in the mirror, but when I saw my skin in a photo, well wow! my skin looked great. I love the finish. It's a bit thicker in texture compared to some other light coverage foundations, so it takes a bit more blending, but it's worth it. I highly recommend this.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of my favorite foundations and has been on my list of top foundations from the very beginning! it melts into the skin and is full coverage for my skin type (oily, minimal skin blemishes, acne prone).

reviews.review_text: I was really excited for this product and it lead to huge disappointment. When I invest my money into a pricey product, I want to be satisfied. This is for you if you have oily skin, like a skin-like to matte finish, and really like the smell of baking soda. None of their selections were light enough for my skin tone. I could not pull off the 'my skin but better' look, it is thin and light, but you can tell I'm wearing some sort of foundation. Not the worst, but certainly not worth my money.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve used this foundation ever since it was launched and InStyle magazine voted it the best foundation. I‚Äôve tried other brands throughout the years but haven‚Äôt found anything else better. It glides on beautifullly and provides light to medium coverage depending on how you apply although I find it works best with a brush. Works well with my combination skin where I‚Äôm drier on the cheeks and have slight shine on my nose and forehead. The result is a flawless skin and slight luminous glow that‚Äôs not shiny but more like you‚Äôre glowing from good health‚Äîa lit from within look. I already have good skin where people come up to me to compliment my skin but I use this foundation when I want a more polished look. It‚Äôs not a no-makeup look foundation (for that I use the GA Face Fabric foundation or Tom Ford powder foundation). This looks especially beautiful with either MUFF or It Cosmetics HD powder (if you‚Äôre not going to be in front of flash camera). Highly recommend! Totally worth it.

reviews.review_title: IF you can find your colour, BUY IT!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This is one of best foundations I've used.  For reference I've used Tarte tan sand and Fenty 350.  This is goes on like air, super light.  I do have hyper pigmentation which I cover with concealer first.  It literally glides on and is build-able. I wish they had a more mini samples for ladies of colour.  I did dive in a buy it and it was worth it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin

Well I am completely WRONG.  This foundation is so light and provides great coverage. It like melts right into my face. I usually use 1 or 1

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation so much! It never looks cakey, and I always get complimented that my skin looks amazing, when I‚Äôm actually wearing foundation! I love the subtle glow it leaves on your skin, and I find it actually looks better the longer you wear it. I go to the gym and after work, and I usually never take my foundation off (which I know is terrible), and it still looks amazing after a sweaty gym sesh! Couldn‚Äôt recommend more, you need this!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have combination skin, and the first time i bought this product it was like heaven on earth. I bought it a second time whenever I ran out. There is a 100% noticeable difference between these two batches. I may try and find the exact batch on the box soon, becuase the second one is not right at all. The first batch was easy to layer, as the second is almost sheer and takes forever to build up. I've noticed it's started to break me out also right as i began using the second batch. It also seems to irritate the areas that breakout. This second batch is almost like an entirely different foundation, even the shade on my face is a tad more pale than the first and i'm a homebody that stays one color, i dont tan unless it's fake. I'll definitely buy the product again however, because the first batch was undoubtedly flawless and lovely, but i'll definitely exchange for another bottle if i notice something odd. (note i did buy the exact shade and everything, not entirely sure as to what went wrong, but things happen :), dont let this scare you from buying the product, but if you use this foundation regularly and notice a difference, dont let your $ go to waste and just exchange for a better batch)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Ugh it is gorgeous. I didn‚Äôt think I liked this at first. I thought it only looked beautiful maybe two hours, but gave it another shot. For me, Smashbox Photo Finish primer makes a perfect teammate with this foundation to lengthen its wear life. I have eczema on my face and this has not caused a flare up. I set my face with Hourglass Ambient Lighting Powder in Dim Light. It‚Äôs so expensive, but I love it!! It doesn‚Äôt feel like I am wearing make up and somehow gives decent coverage while looking natural.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: My absolute fave! Highly recommended!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: One of my favorites. Easy to apply, and makes your face look photoshopped. I can see why so many makeup artists use this!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Du pur bonheur!! Le top des fonds de teint! Il vaut grandement son prix.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Deep skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: If your looking for something lightweight that has natural coverage this is for you! I've always had trouble finding my shade and this one works perfectly, I also hate when I feel like I'm wearing foundation so this ticked off another one of my boxes. It has a natural finish so if you want something more full coverage this wouldn't be the best unless you want to pack it on but if you do have oily/dry patches it will look so off. Also it does not OXIDIZE which is huge because as a coloured person foundation tends to look orange on me at the end of the day i.e.MAC foundation look disastrous on me, I'd say I have a warm to neutral skin tone. I like to say I'm the forgotten shade in the makeup industry. The only reason I am not giving it a 5 star is because I can be a tough critic when it comes to my skin so when it comes to days when I have those acne eruptions it doesn't do much to cover them :( the white head comes poking out the foundation. Other than that I love this and I'm glad that Sephora is now carrying the full range because I use to buy it a Holt Renfrew (Canadian dept store) to purchase it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love love love this product

The shades are also wonderful for those with beige/yellow undertones like myself. I apply with a Beauty Blender and finish with Charlotte Tilbury's Genius Magic powder.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin

reviews.review_title: Absolutely in LOVE! This is the ONE!!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Over the past few years I have searched high and low for my favorite foundation. Now that I am 41 my preferences for foundation seem to be ever changing... Search no more, this is the ONE. Where do I begin, so many great things to say about GA LS. Even though it‚Äôs is a bit more pricey compared to other high end foundations, it is well worth the splurge. $10-$15 more is a small price to pay for perfect glowing healthy skin. So many pros to list:  -applies easily with a brush or sponge -flawless even coverage, about medium -layers well over sunscreen (Farmacy) and primer (Tatcha) -long wearing, 10+ hours if not more -does not settle into fine lines or pores -photographs beautifully, day or night  -perfect for mature skin, not too heavy but provides enough coverage for radiant flawless skin -so many compliments on my skin when I wear this, also hands down my husband‚Äôs favorite -loved by so many makeup artists, celebrities, and influencers for a reason   If you have mature combination skin and have not tried this foundation yet, I definitely recommend trying. I‚Äôm in love!! My only regret is that I did not try sooner. Better late than never. :)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This foundatiin looks great and wears the whole day, and my day is really long. I apply it at 6 am and it lasts without touchups until 10 pm when i take it off. reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Amazing foundation. Feels like a second skin and isn‚Äôt heavy at all. Most foundations make my face itch, but not this one.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Literally wore this foundation for 12 hours and didn‚Äôt even move. I went to a drag show, had a dinner and still looked amazing Definitely one of my favorites

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I had a dramatic change in my skin during the time I was using this foundation, I was oilier and darker before, and then I became paler and dryer in most areas, and it worked well with both complexions, your nose will require touch-ups regardless, this foundation is  quite smoothing for the most part and doesn't clog your pores like most others, but it is not 24hrs in all areas of your face (nose and forehead especially). The packaging is pretty but will make it oxidize over time, I've had to exchange it a few times for new bottles. It's important to note that the coverage is absolutely medium and requires careful building as to not look cakey. I recommend applying it with the Marc Jacobs 'The Face II - Sculpting Foundation Brush No. 2' for higher coverage, and with a beauty blender for a more natural look. Use it with Guerlain's 'M√©t√©orites Primer Perfecting Pearls' for a soft glow in matte or radiant finish. It will enhance redness in acne if you do not colour correct beforehand.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: When I first used this foundation, I was very ecstatic! I thought I'd found the *perfect* foundation, and I immediately took some selfies and told my friends what foundation I was wearing so that they could run out and buy it too! However, even though I truly did love and enjoy this foundation, it is also really expensive and I have since found other foundations I like just as much for almost half the price. I think I was so astounded by this foundation because I just hadn't used very many foundations before, and I'd been having some bad experiences with a couple, so when I found this one, I thought it was a super-special, one-of-a-kind thing. reviews.review_title: Not up to par with the price point
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: On the search for the perfect foundation.  My skin is freckled, some dry patches (nose, lip area), larger pores on cheek, occasional blemish and some slight redness.  I like a foundation that is skin like, skin tone evening,  doesn‚Äôt emphasize texture and Dewey or satin finish.  Pros: This foundation is light to touch, soft matte finish, and does a fair job on evening my skin tone. Does not make my skin look overly cakey.   Cons: It does not cover my redness completely. I do need to build up coverage on blemish spots and even then it‚Äôs not total coverage. Foundation does cling a little bit to some areas around nose. Finally, the finish is not exactly what I would call luminous... it‚Äôs definitely more Demi-matte.  This is a nice foundation, but at the price point it should be the best foundation. I still prefer my Lanc√¥me teint idole ultra 24hr.  I‚Äôve added an unfiltered photo showing the foundation upclose. Any ‚ÄúDewey‚Äù ness is from Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood flawless filter. I only used my morning moisturizer as a primer and used a pore filling primer on areas of my cheek that have larger pores.  Zoomed it, you can see the foundation clinging to my nose. The spot on my chin not covered by the foundation.

Even if u add another layer, it still maintains a beautiful finish. However after a couple of hours, I find it does become a little oily, but it still looks natural. No flashbacks. Yes, the price is high, but it‚Äôs totally worth it!!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Best foundation ever!!! I would‚Äôve give it 5 stars if I got an exact match but noting that counturing haven‚Äôt fixed. It last all day, sometimes I‚Äôve been more than 8 hours with it and it‚Äôs still intact!!! Love it almost gone already and I‚Äôm reordering #6 hoping will be an exact match, it‚Äôs been imposible but worth trying I fixed with counturing so won‚Äôt mind.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I will NEVER get over how beautiful this foundation is on the skin. I have tried so many foundations, high end and low end, and this one is just unreal. I think it is totally worth the price tag- and I can not believe how many bottles of this I have purchased the past 4 years. Such a beautiful product!

reviews.review_title: Perfect if you want your skin to still breathe
reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love this foundation because you can still see my skin shining through (doesn't look like I'm covered in a thick layer of foundation). Just make sure your skin is hydrated before use (I use Kevyn Aucoin primer and let it soak in before adding on foundation). Only issue I have is the numbering system makes it confusing to find your shade...took me a while to get to the right one

reviews.review_title: Worth it if you find a perfect match
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: To start, I think this foundation is good but since it doesn't meet all my wants/needs, I think it could be better given the $64 price tag.   My skin is dry in winter but I use moisturizing face lotions before applying makeup so my face gets oilier throughout the day. I don't own silicone based primers so I don't wear primers with this foundation. I prefer a light-medium coverage for my foundation and I find that this foundation works best for medium-full coverage. Too little product and the foundation is separating on my oily spots at the end of the day. Too much product and it looks like I'm wearing a mask.   I'm Asian and my skintone is light-medium and shade 4 is too light and 6 is too dark. 4's undertone matches me better (cool olive). Because the foundation is lighter than me, it does look a little white/gray when I wear it. To counter this, I put bronzer on the places where I'm naturally darker. This is a lot more work than I'm used to or like to do and I didn't want to buy #6 because that would mean I spent $128 for foundation that matches me...   Shade matching aside, I'm in love with how this foundation looks when it's dried down. It looks like skin and even when it's heavier it doesn't look cakey and dry. I have noticed though that on my undereye, it doesn't play well with my setting powder. Throughout the day, it settles into fine lines and looks dry but only on the undereye area, the rest of my face looks perfectly fine.   I think this foundation is worth it if you can find a shade that matches you perfectly. I do not think it's worth spending $128 on two bottles just to mix your shade. I don't mix this foundation with any of my other foundations because this (Armani) is primarily silicone based and all my other foundations are water based. Water and silicone don't mix well. I'm still keeping this foundation because my sensitive and acne-prone winter skin can tolerate it and that's more important to me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The best foundation ever! I have a fair skin with pink undertones and I‚Äôve been struggling most of my life to find a perfect shade, which doesn‚Äôt look yellowish or oxidizes eventually. I also hate the feeling of something on my face. But this foundation is unbelievably good: feels lightweight and so natural, yet erases my pores and small imperfections completely. It‚Äôs not great for covering red pimples, but I don‚Äôt expect it to. Also my skin is super sensitive and this doesn‚Äôt cause my any breakouts or irritation. Pricey, but absolutely worth it!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have tried SO many foundations over the years, I have honestly lost count. I decided to try this one based on the numerous good reviews, although I was not too happy about the price.  Well, it is absolutely worth the price! Prior to putting on the foundation, I used moisturizer and a primer. Then, I used the SHISEIDO face brush to apply. Went on super smooth and blended nicely. I used Bobbi Brown's powder to set it.  It is now the end of the day and this foundation is still going strong! It has not set into lines and wrinkles or gotten cakey. I am pretty impressed! I have not used a foundation as good as this one before.....and I've tried LOTS of different brands from MUFE, Too Faced, Lanc√¥me, etc. This one is BY FAR the best!  I am pretty fair and what I love about this foundation is that it does not oxidize. (Hard to find, for sure!) Not to mention this shade matches my skin tone perfectly. Granted, I am not a fan of the high price tag, but I'll pay it because in my opinion, it's worth it to FINALLY have a foundation that does everything it claims it will.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not my favorite. I bought this due to all the hype, but for me it isn't that great. It leaves my skin looking flat and dry.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Deep skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: So everyone has that one foundation, that works no matter what, the one you measure all others against- this is that for me.   I have dry skin (especially in the winter) and this foundation gives me no issues.  (I will say if you're an oily skin person, you might want to get a sample first.) I love the natural radiant finish, I love how it wears, my skin just looks hydrated and gorgeous.    I will say it is not transfer free.  So setting powder is a must.  However if you have dry skin like me, don't over powder.  Just a light dusting in your trouble areas.  I use Hourglass sewing powder or the YSL radiant finishing powder.  Both keep me from looking cakey on top of  this gorgeous foundation.   Yes, it's a bit more pricey than  some but it's a dream.  I love it.  I have some backup foundations that work but this is my favorite.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have never re purchased a foundation except for this one, I am on my third bottle. My skin is dry but foundation never sits nicely on it, and my fair rosy skin tone is so hard to match, but this looks like I have nothing on, it has really nice coverage, bigger spots need concealer but if I‚Äôm having a good skin day I can use this without concealer and it always looks so pretty

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love it but couldn't make it work for me. Not long wearing at all and definitely lighter coverage. I found it broke up around my nose and chin rather quickly. This is definitely a foundation for people who have naturally beautiful skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Never have I ever loved a foundation the way I love this one. I‚Äôve tried so, so many and this is by far the winner. It‚Äôs so silky you don‚Äôt feel like you‚Äôre wearing anything at all, but the coverage is great and a little goes a long way. It‚Äôs absolutely seamless and the finish is gorgeous. I only set it with setting spray and 8 hrs later it looks beautiful. Makes my skin look so beautiful; I get so many compliments (even from my mother, which ain‚Äôt easy). I have drier skin and this doesn‚Äôt settle into lines or cake at all. I only use this about once a week (when I go out) due to the price (I have my drugstore dupe for everyday) but I‚Äôm so glad I have it. So worth it!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So I‚Äôve tried Est√©e Lauder stay all day (beautiful full finish, clogs pores and smells awful), Lanc√¥me Teint idole (leaves me a bit oily still), Chanel lumiere velvet (for my better skin days- sheer coverage), and I‚Äôve had some problems with all of them. This one has become my holy grail and it‚Äôll be hard to find something to replace it. If you‚Äôre on the fence and want to give it a go, I‚Äôd say try it. I have very oily skin and it‚Äôs been perfect for my skin type all day.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Where is the luminosity? I wore a moisturizer and primer and my skin looked drier than the Sahara.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation was SO disappointing! It broke me right out. I have combination/oily skin and I found it melted right off my face. For the crazy price I was expecting it to be the best foundation ever! I ended up throwing it in the garbage.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Being in my 40's and having the beginnings of aging skin, I had a hard time finding the perfect foundation. When I was younger I had much oilier skin and lived for good matte coverage. Now my skin is much drier and I have fine lines. I love the natural dewy look and I had heard about this on Youtube. Got a sample in the shade 5.5 (I have light/medium skin with neutral undertones) and absolutely fell in love with the way my skin looked.  It literally made my skin look and feel like silk. I have such a beautiful glow to my skin when I wear this and I always receive compliments on how nice my complexion is. The best part is that it does not settle into fine lines and it feels weightless. I do use a primer (Becca First Light Priming Filter) but there have been days that I was in a rush and totally forgot to apply primer and the results were still the same, stunning. I don't normally spend a lot of money on one single product but in this case, it is hands down worth every penny to me. This will forever be my holy grail!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got a sample of this foundation. I have dry/combination skin and it felt like the foundation made my skin look more dry. Also, I had applied very very little amount because I like sheer/natural coverage but this is definitely full coverage and made me look like a ghost - probably because Sephora sent a 5.5 but I am probably like a shade or two darker. Giving 4 stars because it would be suitable for people with oily skin or those who like full coverage foundations but not for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Grey eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Well worth the money, beautiful finish and wear
Best foundation ever! Really does go on and feel silky. Only con is that it‚Äôs pricey.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin

It lasts all day without primer or powder and doesn‚Äôt oxide into a colour that fills my skin tone. I don‚Äôt even need concealer with this foundation! 1 bottle lasts me at least 6 months with everyday use.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been using this foundation for over a year and I don‚Äôt think another brand will ever replace the love I have for it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Ugh, I‚Äôm sad to leave this review at 3 stars. I love the finish of this foundation, it sinks well into the skin and blends out beautifully with buildable coverage that doesn‚Äôt look cakey for when those annoying period pimples crop up.   However, this is the ONLY foundation I‚Äôve ever worn that wears off around my nostrils and end of my nose, and I do not touch my face during the day except for touch ups of lipstick. Literally just that area is a problem, and I have extremely dry skin in the winter. I usually avoid setting with too much powder, but I‚Äôve found by the end of the day no matter how much primer, powder and setting spray I‚Äôve put on, my nose is exposed. This wouldn‚Äôt be a big deal, but I have redness throughout my skin so it ends up with a Rudolph effect that‚Äôs not cute. I carried it around for touch-ups because I was determined to make this work, but honestly I shouldn‚Äôt have to at this price point and supposed quality ingredients. The hype is real and justified for the most part, but if you have combo or oily skin so I would err on the side of caution.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Friends think I look more beautiful as I age, but to be honest I think it‚Äôs because I discovered this foundation a couple of years back. It glides on so smoothly and blends in well, a blessing for my combination and uneven skin. My skin has never looked so flawless and I love it!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: IIt took 6 different foundations to find the right one for my skin.  (Laneige,FAB,Dior,Marc Jacobs,Too Faced,Giorgio Armani), all samples that I took home and tried on different  days.  Each one had a different effect on my skin.  Everyday, I would use my Clarisonic for my face, toner, essence, serum, moisturizer,spf then primer (tatcha canvas).  Then use one of the foundation samples then bronzer.  I have dry/combination skin.  This foundation did not feel dry on my skin nor did it make my t-zone shinny in the midday or so.  It will give you a really nice natural finish throughout the day, at least for me.  I do think with my skin type, you really have to make sure that your skin is moisturized.  This was the only foundation (out of the six) that did not give me a shinny t-zone or dry skin patches or foundation settling between your fine lines.  I do think you should try as many samples foundation (including this one) so you can find that is right for your skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: So I am not a huge fan of foundations because most of them look horrible on my oily skin and I don't really like to look made up.  I had been eyeing this product for a while now.  While the price was high, I finally caved in and bought it knowing if it didn't work, I could return it.  This is the best foundation I have used so far.  It looks great on my oily skin.  I don't have to blot as often as I would if it was another foundation and most importantly of all, I look like me.                                                                                   I have learned, however, that when I apply my matte finish water-based moisturizer from Shiseido, I apply the moisturizer while my face is still wet and then apply the foundation.  Turned out to be great.  The only complaint I really have is by 2:00, (applied at 7:30 a.m.) the foundation does seem to disappear, so that's why I gave it four stars instead of five.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Combination skin

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I wanted to love it so much, but it just felt short.  1) When I lightly apply it just for a barely there look, it was ok as an everyday foundation. It gives you a slight glow. However, with the $64 price tag, I don't think it is worth to have as an everyday foundation though. When I tried building more coverage for a full-face look, it made me look like I had very bad texture skin and I don't have acne or problem skin, so I found this very odd.   It photographs amazingly well, so great for your selfie game, but that's about it for me.

It is runny and light coverage.  Don't even know if it is buildable bc its too dark anyway.  I am old, almost 49, so my needs are full coverage and oil control.  This did not meet expectations on either front.  So I gave this to my daughter who is slightly darker skin tone and she had the same reaction.  She thought it was awful as well.  I am shocked that an Armani product is no better than drug store quality, but I do believe this is the case with this particular foundation.

reviews.review_text: I'm a little high maintenance, but I mix in a little bit of shade 4 to get my perfect shade. 4.5 is just a touch too pink for me. (I'm NC25 in MAC) I also like to mix in shade 6 during the summer to get my perfect summer shade (Thank God for the mini sizes now!) I live in Denver, Colorado and it's so dry here This foundation just gives a good buildable medium to full coverage. I recommend using a brush instead of a sponge to apply the foundation, and if you're dry like me, spray some MAC Fix  on the brush before you blend it out and it will not only make your skin look flawless, but it gives your skin a nice glow and helps with any patchy areas as well.

reviews.review_text: This is a nice foundation, definitely a satin or dewy finish, but it feels too heavy for my skin. I have dry skin. If I try to layer more than two products under it (serum and sunscreen), then it pills. Even setting with powder, I feel like it doesn‚Äôt last past 8 hours without needing to be redone. I don‚Äôt use primer (it usually makes me break out), so it might be fine if you use primer. For the price, I expect something to be longer lasting, have SPF, or look flawless. I won‚Äôt repurchase.

I have sensitive skin and it doesn‚Äôt break me out and it doesn‚Äôt make you look oily, just luminous. Long-lasting with primer. A must try!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, mediumTan skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I first received a sample of this foundation with another purchase.  I tried it, not really expecting anything mind-blowing.  But when I checked my makeup after wearing it for a few hours, I was totally blown away and in love!  I am almost 65 years old with lots of sun and age spots on my face, and on top of that I still have oily skin like I did as a teenager.  But my face looked flawless all through the day!  I've never seen my skin look so pretty for hours and hours.  Let's just say this foundation made my face look as pretty as I'd always hoped it could be!  Yes, it is pricey, but I decided it was worth it.  I won't be using it as an everyday makeup, but I have other less expensive foundations that work okay for just running to the store and such.  I will be using this for times when I want to be sure my face looks youthful (like on dates!).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I didn't appreciate Luminous Silk foundation when I was younger and had combination skin but now that my skin is drier, this is the best foundation for me.  I would prefer a full coverage foundation but Luminous Silk is the only hydrating foundation that dries to a natural, satiny finish.  If you have dry skin but hate dewy foundations that move around your face and never set, give Luminous Silk a try.    My only complaints are that I'm not crazy about the fragrance (although it's tolerable and not reeking of cheap perfume like Huda Faux Filter) and the shades could be better.  4 is supposed to be my shade but it doesn't have quite enough yellow for me and the next shade up is too dark so I have to mix in a little of my L'Oreal Pro Glo since I'm not about to pay $64 for another bottle of Luminous Silk just for mixing.

reviews.review_title: GA Beauty Luminous Silk Foundation... YES, PLEASE!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I LOVE this foundation!  It looks like real skin and lasts all day on me, plus it doesn't oxidize.  I'd say it's a light coverage that can be built up and still looks great when layered.  The texture is fairly thin, and blends easily.  It lives up to the name... luminous finish, but doesn't look greasy.  The only negative thing about it is that you only get 1 fl oz for $64, and because I sometimes need to use a little extra to make up for the lighter coverage I don't think it will last long enough for me to just overlook the price.  The appearance and performance of Luminous Silk are what make me want to say that it's worth the price tag.  I definitely recommend this and would totally buy it again!

Coverage can be sheered out to almost nothing or built up to a fuller medium. The texture is a slippery liquid aka it‚Äôs silicone heavy formula. I have combo skin and can do without a primer when using this. Fingers, beauty blender or brush will all give you beautiful results. This has no SPF but let me tell you.... it photographs beautifully! Perfect for everyday or a special occasions. It lives up to its name!

I am curious if a lighter shade might have helped, as the 7.75 was slightly too dark for me. I doubt I will be purchasing this as I need more coverage and prefer more of a matte finish.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôve been waiting for this gem to come to my local Sephora and finally won the prize.  Applied with a brush, with a 1/2 pump for each side of the face, this foundation blends flawlessly.  It‚Äôs been a long time since I‚Äôve used foundation, preferring a tinted moisturizer, or lighter coverage, but needed something else for more coverage.  No other foundation worked.  Certainly this is buildable, but I don‚Äôt think using a sponge applicator works best, though it‚Äôs fine for further blending out.  I have oily skin in the summer and combination in the cooler months.  I used this over Coola matte mineral sunscreen and it disposed of the slight cast, while the matte ‚Äúprimer‚Äù toned down the luminous quality in the warmer months.  I believe a primer is absolutely necessary for this, or any other foundation.  Without one, it applied ok on me, but it‚Äôs longevity was much shorter.  Otherwise, longevity was a solid six hours in the warmer temps, 8 hours in cooler temps.  I didn‚Äôt notice any oxidation, but had my normal T zone issue after a while.  Depending on your skin type, you may need to lightly powder if you also use a powder blush.  Liquid blush went directly over the foundation, but I haven‚Äôt the knack with it.  Overall, the foundation really was luminous, not shiny and the color selection available assures nearly everyone that a match exists.    I will comment that, as much as I appreciate the skin matching efforts that the ladies at Sephora made, the color matched to me, 3.5, was too yellow in sunlight.  I returned for a neutral undertone, 4.5, and am happy.  The moral of that story, I suppose, is to check the tested shade in several kinds of light before committing to it.

reviews.review_text: I hesitated about trying this foundation for years because of the price but now that I've tried it there is no turning back. It gives medium coverage, looks like skin and gives me a beautiful glow. It lasts my entire work day. 3.75 is a great colour match for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I didn‚Äôt want to love this foundation, but I can‚Äôt help myself because it truly is the best! I have tried many many foundations from high end brands, with excellent reviews. I‚Äôve tried drugstore brands. If a YouTuber, or instagram makeup guru recommended it, I‚Äôd try it. There was always somethings little ‚Äúoff‚Äù about everything I tried. Either it oxidized on my face, settled into fine lines, not enough coverage, too much coverage, sat on top of my skin, broke me out, or it was too fragranced.  I always shyed away from the Armani despite its fantastic reviews because of the price. Sometimes you do get what you pay for bc this foundation is perfection! I cannot see it on my face, I cannot feel it in my face, I cannot smell it on my face, and my face looks flawless!  I tried it both with primer, without primer, with moisturizer, without moisturizer, and with moisturizer and primer, and it came out flawless every time. Even after hours of wear it does not oxidize, settle or get funky. I don‚Äôt set it either.  I used the Sephora shade finder online and matched it to a foundation shade that suits me that I already own. I highly suggest buying this in your perfectly matched shade, you will be glad you did. I find it light enough and comfortable enough to wear everyday, but enough coverage to go glam.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: To briefly describe what I love about this foundation‚Äî a gorgeous satin finish that mimics Photoshop and beauty filters, a light breathable texture that leaves my dry to normal skin feeling fresh and never cakey, and a shade range that thoughtfully includes an olive undertoned 6 that is perfect for my summer-tanned skin. I like mixing it with the lightest neutral yellow- based 3 as my complexion gets paler through the colder months. Though this foundation doesn't boast longwear, I don't really mind because it wears off evenly and my skin still looks great at the end of the day, albeit with less coverage. I suppose the only thing I don't love is the price, but I've paid for foundations ranging from dirt cheap to more expensive than this (I know, I'm crazy) and I can't say that anything comes even close‚Äî this is truly in a tier of its own.  I'll even be the first to admit... whenever a beauty guru or YouTube influencer claims this foundation is overhyped, I lose faith in their other recommendations. Yes, I do realize it's unrealistic to expect a product to be a one-size-fit-all, as we all have varying skin types and personal preferences. But my reasoning is if this foundation really didn't work for someone (with an exception to negative reactions from ingredients), I can safely assume they either have very different skin concerns or an incompatible makeup style to mine. If you are on the market for an amazing medium coverage foundation, not quite matte and not quite dewy, but 100% your skin but better, I wholeheartedly urge you to give this a go. Get a couple samples of shades that you think would match you since the numbering system can be confusing at first. But the hassle? Worth it. Bottom line, Luminous Silk is everything I've ever wanted in a holy grail foundation and more. I would literally be devastated if Armani ever discontinued this. Luckily for me, lots of people seem to love this just as much as I do so I don't imagine I'll ever be without it!

It is a medium coverage but buildable to full if desired. It doesn‚Äôt look cakey or flat on the skin. It has a nice satin finish and is indeed luminous. It gives the skin a healthy glow, it doesn‚Äôt look at all oily or greasy though. It lasts well throughout the day, not separating, fading or transferring. It lasts well through heat, humidity and sweat also which is a bonus if you live in a hot climate! I love how this looks and feels on my skin. The only downside is the price, it is $64 USD. However, if you have the money to invest in this product I would highly recommend it! It lives up to its reputation.

The smell reminds me of sunscreen but I‚Äôm not sure if it has spf in it. I don‚Äôt see it say it on the box or anything. The formula is very liquidity but kinda hard to work with. Since it has a velvety finish, I feel like it starts to dry quick and is hard to blend with beauty blender. Also, this is definitely a sheer TO medium coverage. It is very sheer and light weight. If you want a medium coverage, I suggest letting first coat dry COMPLETELY and the. Apply second. You get 1 go oz. Averge size even though bottle seems small. This has a lot of pros and cons. Doesn‚Äôt help that I got the wrong shade as well. But when it does finally dry it has this powdery velvety finish with BEAUTIFUL luminous reflected specks. This seems perfect for oily skin! If you want to glow but not look oily I. The process. Great concept and formula idea, however; like I said be before this is patchy.  I would recommend applying powder on afterwards because it can still feel a little sticky even after it dries. I‚Äôm torn on this foundation. I love the velvet finish with luminosity. And I love light weight foundation that feels like you have nothing on but hate the patchy and mild sticky feeling. I‚Äôm going to try again but maybe with my correct color and see how I feel towards it.  I would recommend this to someone who is skilled with make up and who can really blend.

I didn‚Äôt need a setting powder at all, which is amazing. It looks so good, I considered buying the mini.   However, it doesn‚Äôt wear well through my typical work day. True, it‚Äôs humid here in Honolulu, but I can usually get away with using a blotting paper mid-day to sop up excess oil in my t-zone. But I needed TWO and my forehead still looked greasy, highlighting my poor texture there. This is a dealbreaker. I‚Äôm willing to spend more on foundation that will make me look good 30 days a month, through good skin days and hormonal acne.  In conclusion, this is an excellent foundation but it might not work for people with oily skin.

reviews.review_title: Best foundation I've ever tried, but crap shade ra
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I got a sample of this in shades 3.5 and 6. This made my skin look flawless. I love the natural look of the Power Fabric when prepped properly, and this did not disappoint. It looks totally natural. Probably the only foundation I've tried that doesn't sink into fine lines and makes my skin look better.  My only complaint is the shade range; I'm about an NC25ish, with true olive (green/gray) undertones.  Shade 4.5 matches me pretty ok in Power Fabric, but there is no equivalent in the Luminous Silk.  Shade 6 comes close, but it's too dark.  Shade 4 has similar undertones, but it's too light. Shade 3.5 is deeper than 4.5, but not as deep as 6 and has warm, kinda peachy undertones, which doesn't jive with my olive undertones(it shows up orange or pink on my muted,grayish skin).   I usually settle with golden or yellow undertones, but I feel like all the shades that could match me in this foundation are too pink. The rest are too dark.  I mixed 3.5 and 6 when I got samples and it was almost a match. I think I am going to get shade 4 and just use bronzer or something.  I really wish brands, especially high end brands, would start bringing out light and light-medium shades with olive undertones, or at least golden. Not everybody is yellow,peach,or pink.  Kind of a fail for the price point and such a disappointment as the formula is absolutely flawless. I've read about supposed dupes but nothing lives up to this.  If you can find your shade or an ok shade that you could settle with and have more dry skin/want a more dewy, but not oily, natural look, try this. It's gorgeous.  It lasts all day and actually looks better throughout the day. Crappy shade range aside, I adore this and it's going to be my new HG if shade 4 is workable.

reviews.review_text: This is the most expensive foundation I have ever purchased but I'm so glad that I did.   I'm NC15 and while shade #3 was too golden, shade #2 was just right. In fact, it's one of the best foundation matches I've ever gotten. That alone is worth its weight in gold! I'm pale but have warm undertones as well as pink cheeks from rosacea and a very pale neck so finding the right match is sometimes very hard.  I use a Beauty Blender to apply this and it makes my skin look amazing. My pores look smaller, the redness and my cheeks is much less noticeable, and my skin just looks airbrushed. The finish is similar to Dior Airflash but this is easier to work with and much less wasteful. Plus, this doesn't irritate my face the way the Dior does.

I felt like it had an ashy tone to it and I just wasn‚Äôt a fan of it regardless of how much I tried to like it. reviews.review_title: Decent foundation, didn't live up to the hype
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, auburn hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This foundation is good enough, but for the price I need to be wowed, and sadly I was not. The finish is neither too matte nor too dewy, which I like. It looked good throughout the evening I wore it, but started to separate slightly around the 5-hour mark, like a typical foundation on normal/combo skin. The coverage was plenty for my needs/taste, I would say it is medium (of course depending on how much and how you apply, I used a sponge). It didn't particularly highlight pores and texture, but it didn't minimize them either. All in all there was nothing bad about this foundation, but for me personally there are plenty of other products on the market for $20-$50 less that perform equally well. It actually performed very similarly to my go-to K-beauty BB cream (which usually sells for $13), just with a bit more coverage. It goes a long way, so it's not a bad investment if you love it, but it just didn't live up to the hype on my skin. Since I'm trying to avoid liquid foundation altogether right now due to clogged pores, it'll probably be going back.

If I want it more dewy or hydrating I'll add a drop of Physician Formula's Oil Elixir or Laura Mercier's hydrating primer. Definitely play around with it :)

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, black hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am a makeup/skin care/beauty addict so of course I was wanting to try this foundation out for a WHILE but couldn‚Äôt justify it with all the foundations I already own (ahem..I mean hoard lol) I have always heard great things about Armani Luminous Silk but was thrown off by a couple things. I have very fair, cool toned, DRY and sensitive skin with a tiny bit of redness. Though the name implies it has a dewy or ‚Äúluminous‚Äù finish to it, the people I have seen really loving on it have preferred the matte look and had mostly normal or combo skin. I got over it and decided to just get it.  I think this foundation is wonderful. I have never had a foundation match my skin so well without having to mix 2 or even 3 shades together. I am a 3.75. It doesn‚Äôt cling to any of my dry spots (which was my biggest fear) it doesn‚Äôt appear to sit on top of the skin, rather it looks LIKE my own skin with a beautiful luminous finish. Like I said I‚Äôm dry so I‚Äôm not big on caking on the powder. I just lightly set my face with powder at the end of my makeup routine. No baking. This foundation still doesn‚Äôt slip around or get eaten up even though I don‚Äôt cake on the powder. This foundation is also very long wearing as long as you properly set it. Good for long days or photography. For extra coverage in those situations (and to set it even more) you can go in with the powder foundation version of this over top the liquid foundation. It also plays well with most of my other foundations and concealers. Fantastic! I have only one complaint and it‚Äôs not even really a problem with the foundation itself but the PRICE. WHEW! In my opinion though I would repurchase this as I don‚Äôt wear it as my ‚Äúevery day‚Äù foundation. I stick to my L‚ÄôOr√©al Pro Glow foundation for day to day and my Armani for special occasions, when I want to look extra snatched and when I need my makeup to last all day/night. Great foundation! I recommend!

reviews.review_text: I'd really like to rate this product 4.5. After using this once, I wasn't immediately in love with the foundation; it didn't seem so extra special that it could beat more reasonably priced foundations. BUT...
